snowy plover.author: Liz N.
snowy plover.review:
I LOVE Andytowns! 

My first visit there was Saturday. My friend and I ordered 2 snowy plovers, a strawberry corn meal muffin and a cheesy scone. My friend loved the scone so much she commented that it was better than Arizmendi's. 
Everything was delicious! The snowy plover consists of ice, brown sugar syrup, sparkling water, a shot of fresh espresso and their thick homemade whipped cream. This is now my go to drink of choice ;)
After my friend and I finished drinking our snowy plovers we were seriously debating getting in line again to get another (yes it was that good! But yea the line.) So good that it's Sunday and I'm drinking my snowy plover writing this review!!!

excerpts: The signature drink here is the snowy plover.
Concocted from a shot of espresso, sparkling water, simple syrup, and homemade whipped cream, this refreshing beverage is sure to cool you on the hottest of Indian summer days.
I'm a little bit surprised by how good it is given the industry standard to frown upon mixing espresso with any iced beverage.
Make sure to also grab a fresh cheddar scallion scone to go with the coffee!
snowy plover.author: Bailey Z.
snowy plover.review:
One of the things that was missing from the Outer Sunset was a great, neighborhood coffee bar. Sure, there's Trouble Coffee, but who wants to deal with rude baristas who scoff at your lower espresso IQ. Andytown fills this void and I could not be happier at how this grassroots project has turned out. 

The friendly staff has been grateful for the support that they have received in putting together this community startup and this has translated into quality coffee, amazing housemade pastries, and ties to local ceramics (see the dinosaur mugs). The signature drink here is the snowy plover. Concocted from a shot of espresso, sparkling water, simple syrup, and homemade whipped cream, this refreshing beverage is sure to cool you on the hottest of Indian summer days. I'm a little bit surprised by how good it is given the industry standard to frown upon mixing espresso with any iced beverage. 
Make sure to also grab a fresh cheddar scallion scone to go with the coffee!

excerpts: Their most well known drink is the Snowy Plover, which is a sweetened double shot of espresso over pellegrino water, topped off with a large helping of house-made whipped cream.
The whipped cream is AMAZING.
It's thick, creamy, and the perfect sweetness to accompany the espresso.
The Snowy Plover can be pretty heavy by itself, so I often like to get the 'Snowless' version without the whipped cream -- a tasty alternative to a normal cold brew or iced coffee.
snowy plover.author: Eric W.
snowy plover.review:
My favorite coffee place in the city. I love starting my day Saturday or Sunday mornings by stopping by here for a coffee or cappucino and then walking over to Devil's Teeth Baking Co. for a breakfast sandwich. 

Their espresso drinks are some of the best in the city. They do a killer almond latte, almond mocha, and cappucino. Their most well known drink is the Snowy Plover, which is a sweetened double shot of espresso over pellegrino water, topped off with a large helping of house-made whipped cream. The whipped cream is AMAZING. It's thick, creamy, and the perfect sweetness to accompany the espresso. The Snowy Plover can be pretty heavy by itself, so I often like to get the 'Snowless' version without the whipped cream -- a tasty alternative to a normal cold brew or iced coffee. 

The baked goods at Andytown are also fantastic. The corn muffins, scones, and cookies are all delicious. The soda bread is good too, but a bit plain for my tastes. 

Also, the staff is super nice and friendly, much more so than the nearby Trouble Coffee, whose employees don't really seem like they enjoy working there at all. 

Outer Sunset is a bit out of the way of most things in the city, but Andytown is definitely worth the trip.

excerpts: Also they are known for their snowy plover (espresso, soda water, & whipped cream); it sounds really weird
but it's actually really good!
snowy plover.author: Steph V.
snowy plover.review:
A great coffee shop in the Outer Sunset! My friend and I came here today and we ordered almond milk lattes, a blueberry corn muffin, and a soda current scone. The lattes were great - the perfect espresso to milk ratio. The soda current scone was also really good, but the blueberry corn muffin shined through. I think their use of corn in the pastries is what makes them so good. If you come here, definitely get a pastry. The muffins...are to die for. Also they are known for their snowy plover (espresso, soda water, & whipped cream); it sounds really weird but it's actually really good! I recommend this for first timers, it's an Andytown signature. 

The place is pretty small, and it gets super crowded all the time. It's more of a pick up and go type of place, although if you are lucky and wait around you can sit at the little communal table or one of the few tables against the wall. The place has a really beachy hip vibe mixed with the trendy San Francisco coffee shop vibe without being snooty and pretentious as a lot of other places. The people are always nice, and you never are intimidated to ask for help or for any information on the coffee or just talk to them about anything.

Overall, Andytown has definitely topped my list of best coffee places the City has to offer.

A fresh currant scone topped off a delicious morning. 

Can't wait to visit again :)

and I've never had anything like that.

snowy plover.review:
This cafe reminds me of some pop-up shop in New York. I love finding new cafes in my neighborhood. They always have something different, and that snowy plover drink is definitely a first for me ... preeetttyy delicious. 
I'm not some coffee connoisseur, but I've had my fair share of different types of caffeinated goodness and I've never had anything like that. The best part about it is that homemade whipped cream...mmmmmm... If someone gave me a tub of that, I would get a spoon, sit on my fatass, put on Netflix, and shamelessly eat it on a Saturday night. 

4.5 stars for the drink. Extra half star for the barista not getting offended with that stripper joke I made and carrying it on.. Kudos, sense of humor is always appreciated. :)

snowy plover.review: Love the Snowy Plover & Raspberry Corn Muffin ! A must have every time I visit in town. The weight time line to order is about 15-20 min. Dog friendly outdoor place with treats.

excerpts: The snowy plover combines everything I love - fizzy h2o, espresso and fresh whipped cream.
snowy plover.author: Denise K.
snowy plover.review:
This place is...freakin awesome and my new favorite coffee spot!

The snowy plover combines everything I love - fizzy h2o, espresso and fresh whipped cream. Truly, heaven in a cup :).

This coffee spot is super cute and the staff is very friendly. I found a seat towards the back and Michael (I think is the owner) asked me, "how's the P-Lover"...I told him it was my first time having it and it was awesome.

More P-Lover's to come my way very soon ;).

excerpts: My favorite drinks are the almond milk latte, which somehow tastes creamy, and the snowy plover, which is like a coffee root beer float.
snowy plover.author: Niku B.
snowy plover.review:
I LOVE this place! The staff is friendly, the drinks are on point, and the pastries and bread are super tasty. 

My favorite drinks are the almond milk latte, which somehow tastes creamy, and the snowy plover, which is like a coffee root beer float. 

Their savory offerings are my favorite. If they have it, I highly recommend the cheddar and scallion scone, and the raw cheddar and bacon on either of the bread choices. Soooooo good!

It's a really light, airy, fresh feeling place with a beautiful wood table in the front for shared seating and 3 or 4 small tables and stools along one wall inside. There is also some outside seating with surprisingly sturdy wooden folding chairs outside. For as small as the space is I think they've worked in a decent amount of seating. 

Excellent coffee shop with everything you could want: good coffee, tasty food, friendly staff, and beautiful decor. Love, love, love it!

excerpts: It's a block away from the beach, which means I can order my Snowy Plover (best drink in the entire universe) and hang out at the beach on those nice San Francisco dayzzz.

It's a block away from the beach, which means I can order my Snowy Plover (best drink in the entire universe) and hang out at the beach on those nice San Francisco dayzzz.

Also, go early for their coveted cornbread which are sweet and sell out quickly.

excerpts: Known for their snowy plover...
don't be weirded out by the pellegrino part.
It's FANTASTIC.
Only problem for me is that they tend to be a little heavy on the cream, but it's nice that it's whipped cream
so you can always scoop some out for taste.
snowy plover.author: Annie S.
snowy plover.review: Wish this spot wasn't quite so deep into the city and was more accessible. The spot is REALLY SMALL...don't expect to snag a seat inside. The outdoor seating is also pretty limited, but done really nicely. On a nice day, the outdoor seating proves to be really pleasant. They are small, fast, clean, and efficient. Known for their snowy plover...don't be weirded out by the pellegrino part. It's FANTASTIC. Only problem for me is that they tend to be a little heavy on the cream, but it's nice that it's whipped cream so you can always scoop some out for taste.

excerpts:
But the thing that really caught my attention was a drink called
The Snowy Plover.
And try the Snowy Plover - it's quite invigorating.
snowy plover.author: Dan B.
snowy plover.review:
Andytown happens to be this corner coffee spot which mercifully provides excellent artisan coffee to those of us living out in the Outer Sunset.

At this point, I would go into some description about their coffee and/or espresso drinks, either that or some ramblings on how I'm loving the fact they got some of their initial funding through Kickstarter.  But the thing that really caught my attention was a drink called
The Snowy Plover.

For those of you who are familiar with what an egg cream is, it's kinda like a coffee version of that.

For those who don't know what an egg cream is, allow me to explain:
It's a fountain drink (which I usually associated with NYC) that consist of thick chocolate syrup, seltzer water, and milk.  Those ingredients are blended together (to which there is some debate on whether the chocolate or the seltzer goes on the bottom) to create a rather refreshing not so sweet chocolaty drink.

For those of you familiar with Yoo-hoo, it reminds of the chocolate one.

For those of you who don't know what a Yoo-hoo is:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yoo-hoo
(I'm tired of writing).

Where was I going with this review?
Oh right, the coffee . . . 

The coffee has a clean bright finish and is super smooth.  The cappuccino also exhibits that lighter taste and is a real nice change from the ones that have a little more bite to them. 
And try the Snowy Plover - it's quite invigorating.

excerpts:
Two words: Snowy Plover

Cute, straight out of Pinterest, coffee shop in Sunset!
I got to try their famous Snowy Plover!
I wanted to get a latte
but I could get a latte anywhere, the snowy plover though is unique to this place.
The snowy plover consists of Pellegrino sparkling water, espresso (already sweetened with brown sugar), and homemade whipped cream.
The simplicity of this drink shouldn't fool you because it's wonderful and refreshing.
It's basically a fizzy coffee drink.
I'm not a fan of cream but their whipped cream was delicious...almost like ice cream.
So glad I got this drink
First time trying the Snowy Plover, I love sparking water and sparking drinks so this sparking caffeinated drink was right up my alley.
Next time, I will ask for more sugar or more syrup but the fluffy house made cream was a nice addition to the drink.
From pictures, the cream looked like ice cream and I think ice cream would have made a really nice addition to this drink!
It would have really been a coffee float!
I will come back again to try the lattes and pastries!
As I was ordering I've noticed that a lot of other customers ordered the lattes, I like sweeter drinks
so I will have to give them a try next time.
Parking was not bad either!
Always a nice plus!
snowy plover.author: Jennifer H.
snowy plover.review: First time trying the Snowy Plover, I love sparking water and sparking drinks so this sparking caffeinated drink was right up my alley. Next time, I will ask for more sugar or more syrup but the fluffy house made cream was a nice addition to the drink. From pictures, the cream looked like ice cream and I think ice cream would have made a really nice addition to this drink! It would have really been a coffee float! I will come back again to try the lattes and pastries! As I was ordering I've noticed that a lot of other customers ordered the lattes, I like sweeter drinks so I will have to give them a try next time. Parking was not bad either! Always a nice plus! ;)

excerpts: The snowy plover has opened up our eyes to all that can be done with coffee.
Way to think out of the box and deliver a truly unique and delicious drink.

snowy plover.review: The snowy plover has opened up our eyes to all that can be done with coffee. Way to think out of the box and deliver a truly unique and delicious drink.

The mocha, hot chocolate, and snowy plower all come with whipped cream, which I think is delicious.
It is thick creamy and home made.
I highly recommend all of their coffee drinks.
I have also tried the snowy plover, which wasn't my favorite.
Many people seem to come in and ask for it.
It is espresso with sparkling water and whipped cream on top.
snowy plover.author: Julie L.
snowy plover.review:
This place has some of the best coffee I've ever tasted. They also have teas and hot cocoas. I've had their coffee, mocha, hot chocolate, and famous snowy plover. The mocha, hot chocolate, and snowy plower all come with whipped cream, which I think is delicious. It is thick creamy and home made. I highly recommend all of their coffee drinks. I have also tried the snowy plover, which wasn't my favorite. Many people seem to come in and ask for it. It is espresso with sparkling water and whipped cream on top. For me, the sparkling water is just a little strange, but other people seem to love it and come here just for that drink!

This place also has delicious baked goods. Their cookies crumble when you eat them and are super sweet, but not overly so. Their scones are pretty good, but a little dry. But my favorite is the soda bread, which comes with cheddar cheese or jam (also their oven closes at 3pm, so be sure to get there before that!)

The service here is friendly and attentive. They always strike up conversation and make you feel welcome. The baristas are talkative and take the time to talk to you and recommend drinks if you want. Also, shoutout to the barista that gave me a free coffee refill when they were about to close!!

I also find this spot suitable to get a little bit of work done. There is wifi and one large table you can share with others where you can sprawl out and get stuff done. There are other smaller tables inside and a bunch outside as well. This cafe has a nice vibe with good music and the sound level is fine for reading or whatever you need to do!

Side note, this is one cafe in sf that actually has street parking! I don't have to struggle to parallel park or spend half an hour finding a spot!

excerpts: Whipped cream is probably my favorite food (judge away, I don't care), so the snowy plover is my dream drink.
You may not think that fizzy coffee sounds like it would be good.
Just trust the folks here and try a snowy plover.
You'll be thanking yourself for days.
That said, I prefer to take my snowy plover to Ocean Beach or to one of the three or four tables outside to enjoy some nice weather.
I haven't yet tried their baked goods, but people seem to clamor over the scones and cookies, so
snowy plover.author: Alex G.
snowy plover.review:
Every single time I'm in the Bay Area, I trek to the Outer Sunset to make the trip to A-town. Whipped cream is probably my favorite food (judge away, I don't care), so the snowy plover is my dream drink. You may not think that fizzy coffee sounds like it would be good. Just trust the folks here and try a snowy plover. You'll be thanking yourself for days. The espresso is so smooth, it's just the right amount of sweet, and it's refreshing while still feeling indulgent with that giant glob of homemade whip on top. 

The decor in here is stunning- there's a huge wooden table towards the front of the shop that gets amazing light on a nice day. That said, I prefer to take my snowy plover to Ocean Beach or to one of the three or four tables outside to enjoy some nice weather. I haven't yet tried their baked goods, but people seem to clamor over the scones and cookies, so I'd assume they're pretty solid. 

Bottom line: if you want great quality coffee done in a unique way in a beautifully designed shop, Andytown is definitely worth the ride on the N.

excerpts: I ordered the snowy plover and boy
it was great.
I love trying different coffee drinks that aren't common in typical coffee shops or Starbucks etc.
The snowy plover is that unique drink you can't order anywhere.
I don't understand why the best places are usually not as spacious and it took my friend
and I awhile to even get a table to stand/
put our drinks down and chit chat.
People love hanging out at this coffee shop
so it's understandable.
I regret not ordering the cheddar scone because I heard it's super delicious but something I'm looking forward to get next time.
And to the baristas at this place, you guys are awesome!!
So friendly.
snowy plover.author: Anne F.
snowy plover.review: I'm absolutely in love with this coffee place. It's crowded every single time because the coffee is that good! I ordered the snowy plover and boy it was great. I love trying different coffee drinks that aren't common in typical coffee shops or Starbucks etc. The snowy plover is that unique drink you can't order anywhere. I don't understand why the best places are usually not as spacious and it took my friend and I awhile to even get a table to stand/put our drinks down and chit chat. People love hanging out at this coffee shop so it's understandable. I regret not ordering the cheddar scone because I heard it's super delicious but something I'm looking forward to get next time. And to the baristas at this place, you guys are awesome!! So friendly.

excerpts: Finally tired their famous snowy plover.
Wasn't a fan.
Somehow it tasted salty to me.
The whipped cream was delicious
but I think the pellegrino threw me off.
I would've enjoyed it more without the carbonated water part.
snowy plover.author: Michelle K.
snowy plover.review:
Finally tired their famous snowy plover. Wasn't a fan. Somehow it tasted salty to me. The whipped cream was delicious but I think the pellegrino threw me off. I would've enjoyed it more without the carbonated water part. I guess when it comes to coffee, I like to stay traditional.

The space was cute and the baked goods smelled great! Next time I'll try one with a cup of old fashioned americano.

excerpts:
My party ordered:

SNOWY PLOVER ($4): Interesting and innovative beverage consisting of layers of San Pellegrino carbonated water, coffee, and thicker/denser whipped cream;
snowy plover.author: Jacquie H.
snowy plover.review:
Andytown Coffee Roasters makes any coffee experience a unique one and everybody needs to make a stop here at least once. It's not like any other coffee shop I've been to. It's innovative while its product and decor are quirky and rustic. It's everything I love found conveniently in one location.

The ideal coffee experience:

COFFEE + PASTRY + TALKING WITH FRIENDS OR FAMILY OR COWORKERS

Even though Andytown Coffee Roasters has nailed both the coffee and pastry segment, they need to work on the third part. I enjoyed their product but they really need to have more seating inside though there is a little bit of seating.

My party ordered:

SNOWY PLOVER ($4): Interesting and innovative beverage consisting of layers of San Pellegrino carbonated water, coffee, and thicker/denser whipped cream; Mixed together it's very similar to a snowfall coffee with a very slight soda flavor; Though I was initially skeptical about the carbonated water (since I'm not a fan of a fizzy taste), I enjoyed it; The coffee and carbonated water melded together much better than I expected and the whipped cream gives the coffee that distinct flavor; Highly recommended for those who enjoy snowfall coffee with a hint of fizz

CAPPUCCINO ($3.50): Didn't really have this one but my bro said Andytown exceeded every aspect of what he likes in a coffee; Very smooth and light; Not bitter in the least bit; Nice coffee art; Excellent temperature control

STRAWBERRY AND CHOCOLATE SCONE ($3.75): Andytown nailed the texture; Slightly warm, toasted, and crumbly; Strawberry taste was infused throughout the entire scone

SERVICE: Really patient and answered our questions thoroughly; Came out with the coffee's and scone (pre-made but still warm) very quickly

DECOR: Place is cute, rustic, and narrow yet modern with shelves, coffee appliances, and "house" plants everywhere so my kind of place; The actual coffee bar stretches towards the back leaving only a few seats on the sides (probably built for parties of no more than two people), a communal table in the front with windows letting sunlight in, and a narrow walkway; Outside, there is plenty of seating though it's difficult to find at times

Will I return? Yes. But only if I'm in the area since I live quite far. Though I really enjoyed the innovation, beauty of the place, and my whole experience overall, it was a bit too troublesome for me to come here especially with little seating and horrific traffic. However, the coffee and the scones were so superb that it's definitely worth a revisit.

excerpts: We ordered the "Snowy Plover" at Andytown Coffee Roasters on a hot Saturday afternoon.
The weather seemed perfect for an iced drink so we took a stroll over to this local hipster cafe.
snowy plover.author: Winnie L.
snowy plover.review:
We ordered the "Snowy Plover" at Andytown Coffee Roasters on a hot Saturday afternoon. The weather seemed perfect for an iced drink so we took a stroll over to this local hipster cafe. Unfortunately, we forgot to wear our plaid shirts and ride our fixie bikes but they were still very welcoming. 

The line went by quickly. $4 for a cup of espresso over ice, sweetener, S. Pellegrino, and whipped cream. Great concept but I wasn't impressed with the flavor. It was like a coffee cream soda - only good for 5 minutes but gets boring quick. 

3 stars for the convenient location and good customer service but I wouldn't return for the Snowy.

excerpts: My personal favorite is the infamous Snowy Plover with extra homemade cream.
It's basically espresso, pellegrino and a brown sugar syrup topped with homemade cream, and it ends up tasting like a fizzy cream soda iced coffee!
snowy plover.author: Priya S.
snowy plover.review:
Such a great neighborhood coffee shop -- almost makes me wish I lived in Outer Sunset! 

However, thankfully, my company serves Andytown Coffee in our coffee bar everyday! My personal favorite is the infamous Snowy Plover with extra homemade cream. It's basically espresso, pellegrino and a brown sugar syrup topped with homemade cream, and it ends up tasting like a fizzy cream soda iced coffee! Their regular espresso-based drinks are also delicious. 

I've also heard great things about the baked goods but haven't personally tried them myself. My friends rave about the scones and the muffins. 

Definitely head to Andytown when you're in the sunset for a charming and homey coffee shop experience that will make you wish it was morning-time all the time! 

Happy Drinking, Yelpers!

excerpts: I contemplated getting the Snowy Plover just because it's something unique to Andytown, but I had tried an espresso + tonic water before and wasn't a huge fan, so
I wasn't sure if I was gonna like that.
I might come again just to try that though, because I noticed a tub of the homemade cream and it just looked so yummy haha.
They serve hot drinks in the cutest ceramic mugs, which was so much fun to drink out of and made the whole experience seem so luxurious.
snowy plover.author: Sabrina C.
snowy plover.review:
I must admit, I came in with pretty high expectations. I had heard things like "Their coffee is AMAZING" or "Andytown is my favorite coffee shop in the city", so I knew this place was no joke. Still, I wanted to see and judge for myself.

I ventured into Andytown's narrow storefront one Friday afternoon after brunch at Outerlands a couple blocks away, and I was immediately attracted to the big windows, clean aesthetic, and flowers that adorned the counter and the teeny tiny tables attached to the wall. I ordered a cappuccino (my go-to coffee drink) and stared at the pastry display even though I had just eaten because they all looked SO good. I contemplated getting the Snowy Plover just because it's something unique to Andytown, but I had tried an espresso + tonic water before and wasn't a huge fan, so I wasn't sure if I was gonna like that. I might come again just to try that though, because I noticed a tub of the homemade cream and it just looked so yummy haha. They serve hot drinks in the cutest ceramic mugs, which was so much fun to drink out of and made the whole experience seem so luxurious. I'm happy to say that I do think the coffee lived up to the hype; my cappuccino was delicious!

I also wanted to note that I LOVE that they use a manual lever espresso machine. Seeing them do things the "old fashioned" way just made me like this place even more. Keep it up, Andytown!

excerpts: I didn't like the Snowy Plover; it tasted strange to me.
I was looking for something different
and I'm glad that I tried it because a person can miss a lot of great things if they're afraid to step out of their comfort zone.
I usually like the 'different' things I try, but not this time.
I will go back the next time I'm in the area and am looking forward to something awesome.
snowy plover.author: Paul P.
snowy plover.review: Five stars is given based on the customer service.  I didn't like the Snowy Plover; it tasted strange to me.  I was looking for something different and I'm glad that I tried it because a person can miss a lot of great things if they're afraid to step out of their comfort zone.  I usually like the 'different' things I try, but not this time.  I will go back the next time I'm in the area and am looking forward to something awesome.

excerpts: Wasn't a fan of the snowy plover which others really enjoyed here
but that's because it was too creamy for me
and I don't like heavy coffees.
Lots of sun and a cute atmosphere but can get crowded and can be hard to find a seat.
snowy plover.author: Theodora C.
snowy plover.review: Cappuccino was the perfect mixture of bitter and earthy and with no weird aftertaste that some coffees have. Wasn't a fan of the snowy plover which others really enjoyed here but that's because it was too creamy for me and I don't like heavy coffees. Lots of sun and a cute atmosphere but can get crowded and can be hard to find a seat.

excerpts: The snowy plover is Andytown's headliner.
Ice, pelligrino, espresso and a dollop of whipped cream.
The ultimate sunny beach day, caffeinated delight.
The person who invented this drink must have been hungover with a killer stomach ache in need of a refreshing beverage.
snowy plover.author: Rosalyn W.
snowy plover.review:
Quaint little Lawton corner. Parisian outdoor seating. Coffee does the trick! The mocha was just right. Slightly sweet, not sugary. Mostly taste the richness of the coffee bean. Once the beverage was consumed, there was no syrupy brown remanance to line the cup. True artisan coffee. For such a petite size it packed an astute punch. 

The snowy plover is Andytown's headliner. Ice, pelligrino, espresso and a dollop of whipped cream. The ultimate sunny beach day, caffeinated delight. The person who invented this drink must have been hungover with a killer stomach ache in need of a refreshing beverage. Unusual and satisfying. 

I was lucky enough to score one of the last strawberry cornbread muffins. It was better than I had anticipated. The top was a crusty golden brown with crispy edges and fresh lump strawberries inside. The cheddar, scallion scone was equally delicious. Possibly the best scone I've ever had. Savory and moist with a slightly crunchy exterior. I could taste the quality and handcrafted love in every bite. 

There was something authentically kind in the gentlemen making the espresso. A mellow mood you rarely see in this city anymore. Despite the queue, the interaction could easily be classified as a chill, non rushed experience. Maybe it was the fog rolling in or the fact that it is was weekday morning but still an infrequent occurrence  nonetheless. Pleasantly memorable in every way.

excerpts: I stopped into Andytown with my friend a while ago (delayed posting) and have to write a quick and to the point review to let you know that the Snowy Plover, is excellent.
I enjoyed it.
Granted, I had it at 3:30 in the afternoon, so I was wired the rest of the evening cleaning my apartment.
Definitely a stop in if you are in SF or near the area at the beach.
snowy plover.author: J B.
snowy plover.review:
I stopped into Andytown with my friend a while ago (delayed posting) and have to write a quick and to the point review to let you know that the Snowy Plover, is excellent.  I enjoyed it.   Granted, I had it at 3:30 in the afternoon, so I was wired the rest of the evening cleaning my apartment.  Definitely a stop in if you are in SF or near the area at the beach.  Though, I would probably recommend a hot drink if you are going to be outside. 

The butternut squash scone I split with my friend was also super delicious.  

Everything here is recommended!

excerpts: Andytown is small, but I love finding a table outside to enjoy my snowy plover.
The drink has espresso, sparkling water (tonic/ sparkling?) and a large homemade dollop of whipped cream.
The whipped cream at Andytown is heavenly, I'm not sure what crack they put in it.
The snowy plover is so refreshing I can't order anything else here, although their cappuccinos look great.
snowy plover.author: Lauren G.
snowy plover.review:
Andytown is one of my favorite coffee shops  in the city! Highly recommended. During the week, the shop is quiet and slow, on the weekend, there's a line out the door (never too bad). Andytown is tiny, it's definitely not the type of place to hang out with your computer or in a large group. It's sunny, small, cute and delicious. 

Andytown is small, but I love finding a table outside to enjoy my snowy plover. The drink has espresso, sparkling water (tonic/ sparkling?) and a large homemade dollop of whipped cream. The whipped cream at Andytown is heavenly, I'm not sure what crack they put in it. The snowy plover is so refreshing I can't order anything else here, although their cappuccinos look great. 

My favorite pastry here is the strawberry corn muffin - it's sort of a hybrid cornbread/ muffin with fresh strawberries inside. Last time I was here I also tried the jalapeño cheddar corn muffin, which was also great.

excerpts: I have yet to try Andytown's famous snowy plover, but instead opted for a mocha and one of their soda breads, which comes out to about $9.
My order came pretty quickly, and tasted absolutely amazing!!
The mocha is very smooth, blended perfectly, and my soda bread (farl with butter I think) was extremely tasty.
I can definitely see why the place is so well known, and it's almost certain I'll visit this place again!
snowy plover.author: Cindy N.
snowy plover.review:
Andytown can definitely be seen as a very popular place - I've passed this cafe at varying times from opening to close, and it seems to be filled with people hanging out and taking a break from their busy lives. I decided to have a spontaneous visit for the first time this morning, and was greeted by the super friendly staff, and met some wonderfully friendly regulars as well. The place itself is a bit narrow, with limited seats inside, but there's plenty of seating outside. 

I have yet to try Andytown's famous snowy plover, but instead opted for a mocha and one of their soda breads, which comes out to about $9. My order came pretty quickly, and tasted absolutely amazing!! The mocha is very smooth, blended perfectly, and my soda bread (farl with butter I think) was extremely tasty. I can definitely see why the place is so well known, and it's almost certain I'll visit this place again!

excerpts: Finally made it to one of the "must try" coffee shops in SF for the coffee drink that put them on the map, the Snowy Plover.
Unfortunately, it was a wasted trip and Lincoln.
The drink, while unique and innovative, fell flat on its face despite the bubbly sparkling water.
It was sour, and I seriously wondered if the cream spoiled.
The tummy didn't complain so it's probably the subpar coffee they used that gave it the unpleasant sour notes.
Disappointing.
snowy plover.author: S C.
snowy plover.review: Finally made it to one of the "must try" coffee shops in SF for the coffee drink that put them on the map, the Snowy Plover. Unfortunately, it was a wasted trip and Lincoln. The drink, while unique and innovative, fell flat on its face despite the bubbly sparkling water. It was sour, and I seriously wondered if the cream spoiled. The tummy didn't complain so it's probably the subpar coffee they used that gave it the unpleasant sour notes. Disappointing.

excerpts: Tried the Snowy Plover and it definitely lived up to expectations.
I'm a fan of Americanos and I found the sparkling water twist was especially refreshing.
snowy plover.author: Jeany K.
snowy plover.review:
Great coffee, delicious scones! 

Tried the Snowy Plover and it definitely lived up to expectations. I'm a fan of Americanos and I found the sparkling water twist was especially refreshing. The whipped cream adds a really nice creaminess to the drink.

Tried the 2 scones; both were light and moist.
Cheddar Scallion 
Strawberry Chocolate chip (not too sweet!)

excerpts: The snowy plover is a must try!
It's the perfect afternoon pick me up on a sunny afternoon.
It's a carbonated coffee drink with a huge glop of cream in it.
Mix it all together
and it's delish!
snowy plover.author: Dara S.
snowy plover.review: I love this coffee shop! I'm not one to fall into SF's hipster coffee shop trend but I think this one stands out. One, it's location is in the outer sunset. And two, they've created a drink that stands out from the mint mojitos and blue bottles. The snowy plover is a must try! It's the perfect afternoon pick me up on a sunny afternoon. It's a carbonated coffee drink with a huge glop of cream in it. Mix it all together and it's delish!

excerpts: Regarding the Snowy Plover
: I think if soda water mixed with coffee were a great idea, a lot of places would serve it.
Most places have access to both of these things.
snowy plover.author: Masha S.
snowy plover.review:
It's okay. 

Regarding the Snowy Plover: I think if soda water mixed with coffee were a great idea, a lot of places would serve it. Most places have access to both of these things.

excerpts: I go here when I have the chance to work or to grab a snowy plover on a warm day after the beach.
Beach views, awesome atmosphere and great people.
The Outer Sunset has a great community and this coffee shop truly represents that.
snowy plover.author: Brittany N.
snowy plover.review: This is hands down my favorite coffee shop in SF. First of all, the modern and cozy space gets me inspired, the almond lattes are the best I've ever had, the food is unique and amazing (corn bread berry muffins) and the staff is super awesome and friendly. I go here when I have the chance to work or to grab a snowy plover on a warm day after the beach. Beach views, awesome atmosphere and great people. The Outer Sunset has a great community and this coffee shop truly represents that.

excerpts: I'd heard about Andytown and its infamous Snowy Plover and decided to give it a whirl.
As others have described, it's Pellegrino and espresso topped with a dollop of whipped cream.
I was very skeptical of the drink; I'm already not a fan of sparkling water, so I'm not sure what I expected.
snowy plover.author: Mel T.
snowy plover.review:
Let me preface this to say I am by no means a coffee aficionado, but I do enjoy a sweet cup every now and then. 

I'd heard about Andytown and its infamous Snowy Plover and decided to give it a whirl.  As others have described, it's Pellegrino and espresso topped with a dollop of whipped cream.  I was very skeptical of the drink; I'm already not a fan of sparkling water, so I'm not sure what I expected.  I think it's basically a drink that you either love or hate, and unfortunately I fell into the latter camp.

We also tried the mocha, and while we liked the chocolate-y-ness of it, it lacked any coffee flavor, so just resembled more of a hot cocoa.

I really really wanted to like this place with its friendly workers and super cute space, but perhaps I'll just have to settle for their pastries.

excerpts: I really enjoyed the snowy plover.
Be prepared for a line as they are quite busy.
Came here too late the first time for their soda bread 10:30 am but was lucky enough the next time when I got there around 8:30 am.
I really enojyed their scones, definitely recommend.
snowy plover.author: Samantha K.
snowy plover.review: Coffee here was amazing! I really enjoyed the snowy plover. Be prepared for a line as they are quite busy. Came here too late the first time for their soda bread 10:30 am but was lucky enough the next time when I got there around 8:30 am. I really enojyed their scones, definitely recommend.

excerpts: Snowy Plover is tasty and refreshing.
snowy plover.author: Chase C.
snowy plover.review:
Fresh baked soda bread is very tasty. 

Snowy Plover is tasty and refreshing. 

And the coffee is fantastic.

excerpts: The gentleman at "The Coffee Shop" (it's actually called that) on Mission and Cesar Chavez who I think makes some of the best coffee in town said Andytown was his favorite place for their Snowy Plover
and I can see why.
It's espresso, soda water, and some really extraordinary fresh cream.
It tastes so much like a soda that it's hard not to drink the whole thing in less than two minutes.
Which is kinda rough cause they're $4 a pop.
snowy plover.author: Misha T.
snowy plover.review:
The gentleman at "The Coffee Shop" (it's actually called that) on Mission and Cesar Chavez who I think makes some of the best coffee in town said Andytown was his favorite place for their Snowy Plover and I can see why. It's espresso, soda water, and some really extraordinary fresh cream. It tastes so much like a soda that it's hard not to drink the whole thing in less than two minutes. Which is kinda rough cause they're $4 a pop. But it's very worth it. 

ProTip: Grab your cup to go and drink it at the beach

excerpts: Snowy plover...
my indulgence there!
Oh don't forget to get their bread with bacon and cheddar!
snowy plover.author: J W.
snowy plover.review: Snowy plover... my indulgence there! Oh don't forget to get their bread with bacon and cheddar!

excerpts: I tried their Snowy Plover the first time - a little too different for me, but their other coffee drinks are good.
snowy plover.author: Kelsey F.
snowy plover.review: Andytown is a cute little coffee shop, but I do think it's overpriced. I tried their Snowy Plover the first time - a little too different for me, but their other coffee drinks are good.

excerpts: Thanks to Yelp, I found the Snowy Plover.
I had already eaten my breakfast for the day, so I just ordered the $4 Snowy Plover.
I was pretty impressed with the breakfast menu, though, as Andytown does offer a variety of savory options on top of the typical coffee shop pastry offerings.
So, to the Snowy Plover.
Great drink.
I was surprised at how delicious it was.
The drink is basically a mixture of ice, a couple shots of espresso, simple syrup, S. Pellegrino sparkling water, and house-made unsweetened whipped cream.
The sparkling water did a great job of enhancing the flavor of the espresso and the cream tied up the flavor beautifully at the end.
snowy plover.author: Dianna D.
snowy plover.review:
I was on my way to Marin from South Bay on a beautiful Saturday morning and decided to take a quick coffee break in San Francisco. Given the sheer amount of coffee shops in the area, I wanted to go somewhere that differentiated from the typical fairly-traded, shade-grown, small-batch-roasted pour over or latte that I usually get. Thanks to Yelp, I found the Snowy Plover. I was able to get a wonderful glimpse of the ocean before I managed to park my car amidst a sea of other Andytown patrons.

The shop itself was pretty small; there was only enough seating for 3-4 small groups of people. The ambiance was very laid-back, with corner window facing the seascape ahead. The baristas, while very quick, were great at delivering service without sacrificing quality.

I had already eaten my breakfast for the day, so I just ordered the $4 Snowy Plover. I was pretty impressed with the breakfast menu, though, as Andytown does offer a variety of savory options on top of the typical coffee shop pastry offerings. The soda bread and cheese offered on the menu also pleasantly evoked nostalgic memories of northern Europe...

So, to the Snowy Plover. Great drink. I was surprised at how delicious it was. The drink is basically a mixture of ice, a couple shots of espresso, simple syrup, S. Pellegrino sparkling water, and house-made unsweetened whipped cream. The sparkling water did a great job of enhancing the flavor of the espresso and the cream tied up the flavor beautifully at the end. I also found that the foam formed by the cream and sparkling water created an unintended artistic effect.

Great experience to have, and I think it was worth the stop and money to give this unique shop a try. I would come back if I come back to the neighborhood.

excerpts: I got the snowy plover and espresso con panna, the whipped cream they use for both is amazing alone.
The snowy plover is interesting but I suggest just trying it if you never had it before.
snowy plover.author: Kay K.
snowy plover.review:
Super cute place with nice decor and homey ambiance. There's not many seating options so I suggest just taking your coffee to go. I got the snowy plover and espresso con panna, the whipped cream they use for both is amazing alone. The snowy plover is interesting but I suggest just trying it if you never had it before. 

They also have really good pastries made in house and free doggy treats by the door!

excerpts: My favorite drink is the Snowy Plover.
The first time I came in here, Lauren explained to me what it was.
She told me if you're a coffee lover, you're either gonna love it or hate it.
Well, I'm an open minded individual and I LOVE COFFEE so
I ended up loving it.
2 shots of espresso with ice, Pellegrino, brown sugar and homemade whipped cream.
My gawd, I just sold my soul to the Devil.
As Jyang says "COFFEE SODA!" but whatever, I LOVES ITTTTTT.
2 beautifully pulled strong espresso shots and Pellegrino, who would've thunk?
Not me that's for sure.
It makes for a great drink on a hot day (especially since it's been effing humid) but it's just a solid drink all around, during any weather.
It's like a great strong cup of iced coffee with a little zing (from the Pellegrino) that lightens it up a bit.
The piece de resistance is definitely the homemade whipped cream.
I have to say that I hate whipped cream from the can.
Homemade is the shiznitz and let me tell you...
The first day I stepped into Andytown, Lauren gave me a healthy helping of that delectable cream on my first Snowy.
Never looked back...
Well, except to check their store hours.
DAMMIT they close at 3pm
and they're closed on Mondays.
snowy plover.author: Susy C.
snowy plover.review:
There are a lot of shitty things about the outer Sunset, mainly being in the middle of nowhere. There are a few perks and gems here and there, but Andytown is definitely the shining star in my book.
Bright little neighborhood joint with friendly service. I've been told that Lauren and Michael (the owners) are ex Blue Bottle employees. Let me just say that this tells me that they know their shizz when it comes to a good cuppa.

First, let me talk about the space. It's small. There's a big communal table in the front, then I think 3 little doubles tables (outlets under so you can charge your electronics) along the narrow hall. More tables and chairs outside, including a bench right out front. It's a neighborhood joint so it doesn't get too crowded. Sometimes the line looks long (out the door) but it moves fast. What can I say? These folks know how to make coffee! It's very well lit inside, lots of natural sunlight. I enjoy that a lot. Fresh floral arrangements weekly. 

Pastries - I've only had their corn muffins. Each time I come, they just happen to bring some piping hot out the oven. I always get suckered by these. I LOVE THEM. First it was the peach goat cheese corn muffin, then I had some sort of strawberry one but yesterday's fig and orange compote corn muffin might have been my favorite. They are huge. I can never finish one on my own. I haven't tried any other pastry. 

My favorite drink is the Snowy Plover. The first time I came in here, Lauren explained to me what it was. She told me if you're a coffee lover, you're either gonna love it or hate it. Well, I'm an open minded individual and I LOVE COFFEE so.... I ended up loving it. 2 shots of espresso with ice, Pellegrino, brown sugar and homemade whipped cream. My gawd, I just sold my soul to the Devil. As Jyang says "COFFEE SODA!" but whatever, I LOVES ITTTTTT. 2 beautifully pulled strong espresso shots and Pellegrino, who would've thunk? Not me that's for sure. It makes for a great drink on a hot day (especially since it's been effing humid) but it's just a solid drink all around, during any weather. It's like a great strong cup of iced coffee with a little zing (from the Pellegrino) that lightens it up a bit. The piece de resistance is definitely the homemade whipped cream. I have to say that I hate whipped cream from the can. Homemade is the shiznitz and let me tell you... The first day I stepped into Andytown, Lauren gave me a healthy helping of that delectable cream on my first Snowy. Never looked back...Well, except to check their store hours. DAMMIT they close at 3pm and they're closed on Mondays. I swear if they opened up earlier than 7am, I would drive my arse down to Andytown for my fix prior to hauling arse to work.

So yeah... just sign on the dotted line. Your soul? Donezo.

excerpts: I wanted to try something different so got the snowy plover which is carbonated coffee with whipped cream.
I wasn't a fan.
snowy plover.author: Heejin L.
snowy plover.review:
I thought this place was ok.
I wanted to try something different so got the snowy plover which is carbonated coffee with whipped cream.  I wasn't a fan.
The carbonation took getting used to.

The espresso was sour that day and I'm no coffee/espresso snob but my one requirement is for coffee/espresso to not have that sour taste.

excerpts: I always get a Snowy Plover, and it's 1 shot of espresso with brown sugar simple syrup, and sparkling water,  topped off with this AMAZING whipped cream!
[ I always ask for extra whip!]
snowy plover.author: Milli M.
snowy plover.review:
This is one of those hidden gems, located in the Outer Sunset district of San Francisco. They're absolutely one of a kind and continue to hold up their reputations of being one of the coffee shops, if not the best, in the City. 

Decor is very homey, but modern at the same time, it provides a nice bright environment. Seating is limited, but the menu and staff make up for it.

They're scones and corn muffins are always super fresh! And the ingredients they use for their baked goods complement each other. The apple, cinnamon, ginger scone, is a staff favorite, according to the shop, and I can't blame them for loving it! The ginger bits in the warm, soft scone really go well with the apple and cinnamon. 

I always get a Snowy Plover, and it's 1 shot of espresso with brown sugar simple syrup, and sparkling water,  topped off with this AMAZING whipped cream! [ I always ask for extra whip!] Of course, it takes some getting used to, but it grows on you, just like the staff, instantly! 

Service and staff, will make you feel like home and are always in positive and friendly vibes. They'll talk to you as if they'd known you all their life and share funny and amusing stories with you.

The 'master Barista', is super nice! And her latté art skills are Spot.On. 
They have a new seasonal scone: pumpkin and chocolate; I was skeptical, but I was proved wrong. Both worked so great with each other!

excerpts: Coffee very good, eat a super Strawberry Corn Muffin and my friend had a Soda Black Currant Scone with a drink called Snowy Plover (named after a local Ocean bird).
Before you go there visit the beach close by.
Part of the total experience.
snowy plover.author: Johann F.
snowy plover.review: What a great place, felt like old San Francisco, not the Millennium Crowd like in the Mission. Coffee very good, eat a super Strawberry Corn Muffin and my friend had a Soda Black Currant Scone with a drink called Snowy Plover (named after a local Ocean bird). Before you go there visit the beach close by. Part of the total experience.

excerpts: Snowy Plover?!?!
SNOWY PLOVER?!?
SNOWY PLOVER?!?!
Snowy Plover = Coffee Soda.
snowy plover.author: Justin Y.
snowy plover.review:
Snowy Plover?!?! SNOWY PLOVER?!? SNOWY PLOVER?!?! Drive across town and make us Come oVER?!?!?! 

Susy C. was ranting and raving about this place and seeing as JY is a huge coffee drinker we had to check it out. However, seeing is that I don't drink coffee or give two shits about coffee I'm probably not the best critic of this place. However, appreciated the wide variety of scones, the relatively short line, and the SF ambiance. 

Snowy Plover = Coffee Soda. 

Happy trails. 

J to the Y.

excerpts: Snowy Plover - possibly the worst thing I've ever tasted in my mouth.
It is their only cold brew coffee made with soda water (tonic water?)
with an ice cream scoop of heavy cream on top.
snowy plover.author: Terry D.
snowy plover.review:
Cute and hip cafe and best of all within walking distance. This place is always crowded, line is always out the door.

Their corn muffins are good. I've had the jalapeño cheddar  (good kick), strawberry  (decent, buttery), Apple & raspberry jam pocket (very very sweet).

Lattes are good. They use clover milk and make cute designs. 

Snowy Plover - possibly the worst thing I've ever tasted in my mouth. It is their only cold brew coffee made with soda water (tonic water?) with an ice cream scoop of heavy cream on top. The cream is good but the coffee itself was disgusting.

I like coming here just for the corn muffins and latte.

excerpts: I was torn what to order here because everyone raves about the Snowy Plover (an iced drink - someone super creative
must've thought it up - it's sparking water + espresso + homemade whipped cream), but it was so cold
I wanted a warm drink.
I had a couple sips of my friend's Snowy Plover and while it was good at first, I can't see myself finishing the whole thing.
I could taste the acidity of the coffee more when mixed with sparking water
snowy plover.author: Angela C.
snowy plover.review:
I was torn what to order here because everyone raves about the Snowy Plover (an iced drink - someone super creative must've thought it up - it's sparking water + espresso + homemade whipped cream), but it was so cold I wanted a warm drink.  I had a couple sips of my friend's Snowy Plover and while it was good at first, I can't see myself finishing the whole thing.  I could taste the acidity of the coffee more when mixed with sparking water and I wasn't really a fan.  

I ended up with a latte and I much preferred that - it was delicious.  The coffee roast is just the way I like it  - dark and rich.  I'm not a fan of super acidic coffee so I'm glad that wasn't the case here.  The coffee art is fun to see too!  Well crafted coffee and delicious scones.  Definitely give this place a try!

excerpts: The Snowy Plover was so weird.
The idea of carbonated coffee made me skeptical and tasting it confirmed my skepticism.
The sausage roll was sooooo greasy!!!
Blech!
The flavor was overpowering
* Mocha was good!
Can't mess that up
snowy plover.author: Marjo M.
snowy plover.review:
Food
* The Snowy Plover was so weird. The idea of carbonated coffee made me skeptical and tasting it confirmed my skepticism. 
* The sausage roll was sooooo greasy!!! Blech! The flavor was overpowering
* Mocha was good! Can't mess that up :)

Service
The staff was welcoming, kind, and smiling! Always a nice touch

Ambiance
Outdoor seating and awkward 1-2 person seating indoors in a very narrow walkway.

Overall
Perhaps this is just not my scene. I am not a coffee aficionado, which may take away from the review's credibility, but Andytown has not won my heart. I'm not sure what it is with the obsession with uncommon, quirky coffee shops, but I have had better experiences elsewhere.

excerpts: but my boyfriend LOVES the snowy plover, and they never seem to mess that up, so
snowy plover.author: Emmi B.
snowy plover.review:
If only the mochas we're tastier I'd have gone for the full 5 stars. I like the ambiance and usually the food is really good too, but their mochas never hit the spot. A little too bitter I guess? I'm not a fan of sweet mochas, but c'mon these don't even taste like 90% cacao chocolate, it just tastes like a latte with a tiny shake of Hershey's cocoa.

I don't like carbonated beverages but my boyfriend LOVES the snowy plover, and they never seem to mess that up, so I guess if you want a unique, fizzy, iced coffee drink you should for sure try that. 

Finally, I've heard they used to have some amazing sausage rolls but don't anymore. I'm praying those return and I can revise this review based on the amazingness I've heard about those! For now, get the soda bread if you're hungry (it's a 9/10 in my book).

excerpts: Snowy plover is definitely something to try, although I wish they had the cream without sugar as an option-
I think the drink ends up being a little sweet.
Baked goods are to die for!
snowy plover.author: Masha B.
snowy plover.review: So good! Snowy plover is definitely something to try, although I wish they had the cream without sugar as an option- I think the drink ends up being a little sweet. Baked goods are to die for!

excerpts: A sip of snowy plover, a bite of the cheddar jalapeno corn muffin, and all is good again, atleast for the moment...
snowy plover.author: Vin A.
snowy plover.review: How do you make things right?  When you did something wrong, when someone has done you wrong, when you wake up on the wrong side of the bed. The answer is not easy.  But Andytown Coffee Roasters is a good start. This little place that can, does, and does it well. A sip of snowy plover, a bite of the cheddar jalapeno corn muffin, and all is good again, atleast for the moment...

excerpts: If you are up for adventure, try the snowy plover.
That is basically iced carbonated coffee.
They use pellegrino and espresso and ice to make this drink.
Not quite my favorite or a favorite at all, but an interesting concept that's both creative and unique.
Their hot lattes and capps are great.
snowy plover.author: Jennifer N.
snowy plover.review:
Is it a crime to be more excited about the warm blueberry corn muffins than the actual coffee? Because they are that good. So delectable, so warm and with the perfect chewy texture only corn meal has. The muffins bursts with subtle sweetness of the ripened berries, and the coffee a perfect hot pairing on a cold day. 

If you are up for adventure, try the snowy plover. That is basically iced carbonated coffee. They use pellegrino and espresso and ice to make this drink. Not quite my favorite or a favorite at all, but an interesting concept that's both creative and unique. Their hot lattes and capps are great. Bonus: they have almond milk!

On a different subject, andytown has 5 stars! That's rare for yelp. I wish them continued success and I encourage new concepts even if it's a strange concoction of espresso and soda water. I will be back again. And again.

excerpts: The space is a bit cramped (partly because they're so popular), but the food (soda bread with butter, cheddar and bacon), coffee (the Snowy Plover) and service were all A+.
snowy plover.author: Richie T.
snowy plover.review: The space is a bit cramped (partly because they're so popular), but the food (soda bread with butter, cheddar and bacon), coffee (the Snowy Plover) and service were all A+.

excerpts: Cheddar Scallion Scone, Snowy Plover
(wow!), & an Almond Latte.
Holy shit, they hit everything out of the park!
snowy plover.author: Mack B.
snowy plover.review:
We came by for a little pre-brunch pick-me-up.  
Ordered: Cheddar Scallion Scone, Snowy Plover (wow!), & an Almond Latte. Holy shit, they hit everything out of the park! 
When we arrived the line was long but moved quickly. 

The staff is awesome and actually looks you in the eye when you speak to them, always very refreshing. 

The ambiance is great; serious 'feel good' vibes.
Thank you Andytown! We'll be back for more.

excerpts: Get the snowy plover!
Worth the travel to try (if you like fizzy drinks lol)
snowy plover.author: V L.
snowy plover.review: Carbonated coffee has changed my life. Get the snowy plover! Worth the travel to try (if you like fizzy drinks lol)

excerpts: so I always pick up a Snowy Plover and a Soda Farl Bread for breakfast and walk down to the beach to start my Sunday mornings.
snowy plover.author: Aleesa B.
snowy plover.review:
This place is so delightful. The service is always amazing and their drinks are fantastic. It's right next to the beach (about four blocks or so) so I always pick up a Snowy Plover and a Soda Farl Bread for breakfast and walk down to the beach to start my Sunday mornings. 

There's not much space that a typical cafe has to study or do work but there is a community table where you have more space than not. There's no plugs for outlets so it's not an ideal space do work but it's awesome to read a book outside on the outdoor seating or have a chat with a friend. 

This place is by far one of my favorite coffee places in the city.

excerpts: I came here for the first time a while back with my sister and we decided to try Andytown's special snowy plover.
It was very interesting at first and then suddenly BAM!
The snowy plover, mocha, and lattes are all winners!
but let's not forget about ALL of their muffins and soda/wheaten bread!!!
My bf is straight up out of Ireland and he agrees that this Irish-like coffee shop is pretty legit!
snowy plover.author: Michelle L.
snowy plover.review:
So this review is wayyyyy overdue. I came here for the first time a while back with my sister and we decided to try Andytown's special snowy plover. It was very interesting at first and then suddenly BAM! It just came on to us and before we knew it, we were hooked and couldn't stop drinking it! 

Since then I come here every now and then to treat myself. The snowy plover, mocha, and lattes are all winners! but let's not forget about ALL of their muffins and soda/wheaten bread!!! My bf is straight up out of Ireland and he agrees that this Irish-like coffee shop is pretty legit!

excerpts: Get the snowy plover!
So unique and so good!
snowy plover.author: Nicholas M.
snowy plover.review: Small, simple, great coffee. A few small personal tables and a group table inside, with a few tables outside. Wifi available. Expect a line out the door but it won't be longer than 10-15 min. Worth the wait! Get the snowy plover! So unique and so good!

excerpts: The Mr got a snowy plover to go ...
it was okay, not feeling the soda water taste.
DEF must from this place is the jalapeño cheddar corn muffin.
Wanted to go back for another but the line was too long.
Also got this pear jam corn muffin?
I forgot what it was
but that was delicious too!
The crust alone on the muffins was good but ya gotta get a full bite of everything to know how good it is.
Place is pretty small inside with one large table in the front and some singles along the side and back.
There's some outside seating too, maybe two tables?
I will definitely come back for the muffins!
snowy plover.author: enygma g.
snowy plover.review: Got a cappuccino to go, kinda small but cute with the milk.  The Mr got a snowy plover to go ... it was okay, not feeling the soda water taste.  DEF must from this place is the jalapeño cheddar corn muffin.  Wanted to go back for another but the line was too long.  Also got this pear jam corn muffin?  I forgot what it was but that was delicious too!  The crust alone on the muffins was good but ya gotta get a full bite of everything to know how good it is.  Place is pretty small inside with one large table in the front and some singles along the side and back.  There's some outside seating too, maybe two tables?  I will definitely come back for the muffins!

excerpts: Of course, I had to order the most hyped drink, the Snowy Plover.
A bit of carbonated water, espresso and topped with their homemade wiped cream.
What does it taste like?
Just think soda, but coffee flavored.
snowy plover.author: Jane C.
snowy plover.review:
Why do I always follow the hype?! Oh my, oh my, ohh my.... 

Walked in around noon, first impression - what a cute cafe! Wished the space was bigger to accommodate more people inside. I can't imagine when the cafe is busy on a rainy day. People will definitely be lining out the door!

Of course, I had to order the most hyped drink, the Snowy Plover. A bit of carbonated water, espresso and topped with their homemade wiped cream. What does it taste like? Just think soda, but coffee flavored. It's different, but not WOWing.

The BEST part was the Scallion & Cheddar Scone! Smelled it first and I was salivating before I even took my first bite! It's crispy on the outside, but warm and soft on the inside! I think they used cornmeal in for it??? Whatever it is, it was delicious! If I were to be in the neighborhood, I'll definitely be ordering at least a dozen of these! (Alright, I won't be selfish. Maybe only 3 since I don't have a big enough stomach to eat a dozen....).

excerpts: As you can probably already tell from all the reviews, the snowy plover is the thing to get if you're trying this place out for the first time.
I've had a rendition of the snowy plover elsewhere
and I did not like at all.
But after trying Andytown's snowy plover, I'm in love with this combination!
I'd say the whipped cream on top (and maybe partially the espresso) makes it THE Andytown snowy plover.
I will come back to try the soda bread and for another snowy plover!!!!
snowy plover.author: Ingrid C.
snowy plover.review:
Andytown is one of those coffee shops where you're going to have to wait in line for. It's extra tiny inside and there doesn't seem to be a lot of available seats. I went on a Sunday morning and it was packed inside and out..with a line out the door even with the rain. 

As you can probably already tell from all the reviews, the snowy plover is the thing to get if you're trying this place out for the first time. I've had a rendition of the snowy plover elsewhere and I did not like at all. But after trying Andytown's snowy plover, I'm in love with this combination! I'd say the whipped cream on top (and maybe partially the espresso) makes it THE Andytown snowy plover. I will come back to try the soda bread and for another snowy plover!!!!

excerpts: I usually get a mocha or a snowy plover and they're both as delicious as reviews here
say they are.
Their in-house baked goods are also some of the best pastries in town.
There is no lack of consistency here.
I love getting the black currant scones.
The pastries are always perfect.
Every.
Single.
snowy plover.author: Gordon A.
snowy plover.review:
There are SO many things to love about this place.  For starters, it's a beautiful store.  It's right on the corner of Lawton and 43rd with a big corner window.  The interior is tastefully done with a beachy Outer Sunset vibe.  The staff is incredibly friendly.  Lauren and Sandra, two of the baristas there, are just sweethearts.

I usually get a mocha or a snowy plover and they're both as delicious as reviews here say they are.  Their in-house baked goods are also some of the best pastries in town.  There is no lack of consistency here. I love getting the black currant scones.  The pastries are always perfect.  Every.  Single.  Time.

It's just fantastic to have a local neighborhood shop that fits in seamlessly with the neighborhood and doesn't feel like some chain that's been dropped in.  I highly recommend people search out this place.

I only have two slight minuses and it's more to do with how popular the place is.  I wish it were a wee bit bigger to accommodate more indoor seating, although there's plenty of outdoor seating.  It's also not uncommon to find a line out the door.  It's that popular.

Still, those are minor quibbles that do not detract at all from the incredibly positive impression one gets when visiting.

excerpts: I have serious cravings each week for their Snowy Plover and scones.
Snowy Plover - you'll have to try it for yourself, this drink is SINFUL.
I'm not a fan of whipped cream and I don't usually order a lot of iced drinks, but love theirs (homemade) on top of my espresso w/ sparkling water.
I've had a similar drink at both Saint Franks in Russian HIll and Front in Potrero Hill.
Not nearly as amazing as Andytown.
What do you guys put in this thing?!
snowy plover.author: Jackie C.
snowy plover.review:
I cannot get enough of this place and wish they opened longer hours. It's pretty far out but so worth the trip. I have serious cravings each week for their Snowy Plover and scones. 

Snowy Plover - you'll have to try it for yourself, this drink is SINFUL. I'm not a fan of whipped cream and I don't usually order a lot of iced drinks, but love theirs (homemade) on top of my espresso w/ sparkling water. I've had a similar drink at both Saint Franks in Russian HIll and Front in Potrero Hill. Not nearly as amazing as Andytown. What do you guys put in this thing?! Whoa.

And once you've tried their cheddar & scallion/jalapeño scone or blueberry corn muffin you'll be hooked, guaranteed. They're usually fresh out of the oven, HOT + HEAVENLY. 

I'd spend hours at this place almost every weekend. Though they don't have a ton of seating, I always manage to find a spot. Regulars/neighbors are friendly. Adorable dogs. What more can you ask for?

Love these guys. Go.

excerpts: I tried their signature Snowy Plover, which is an iced drink consisting of sparkling water, espresso, simple syrup, and house whipped cream.
So unique and delicious.
It was sweet yet a little sour from the espresso soda water and their whipped cream
is amazing!
I mixed it into my drink to make it creamier, but I was tempted to just eat it with a spoon haha.
I also bought a strawberry corn muffin for $3 - so worth it.
It was a pretty large muffin - we ate it throughout the whole day.
It was perfectly dense and sweet like cornbread and had real strawberries baked into it.
So good!
My bf tried their drip coffee and he liked that too.
We're both fans and will definitely be back!
snowy plover.author: Stephanie G.
snowy plover.review:
This place is awesome! 

I tried their signature Snowy Plover, which is an iced drink consisting of sparkling water, espresso, simple syrup, and house whipped cream. So unique and delicious. It was sweet yet a little sour from the espresso soda water and their whipped cream is amazing! I mixed it into my drink to make it creamier, but I was tempted to just eat it with a spoon haha. I also bought a strawberry corn muffin for $3 - so worth it. It was a pretty large muffin - we ate it throughout the whole day. It was perfectly dense and sweet like cornbread and had real strawberries baked into it. So good! My bf tried their drip coffee and he liked that too. We're both fans and will definitely be back!

excerpts:
Order:
- drip coffee
- snowy plover (coffee, house whip, soda water)
- season corn muffin w/ strawberries (gluten free)

Everything was delish, but the SNOWY PLOVER is my new all time favorite cofffee.
snowy plover.author: Kristen C.
snowy plover.review:
LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS NEWEST ADDITION TO OUTER SUNSET!

They've only been open a few weeks and there's already a line out the door! 

Order:
- drip coffee
- snowy plover (coffee, house whip, soda water)
- season corn muffin w/ strawberries (gluten free)

Everything was delish, but the SNOWY PLOVER is my new all time favorite cofffee. 

Can't wait to go back and try their soda bread with cheese and bacon :)

excerpts: The snowy plover was BEST THING EVER - espresso, San Pellegrino, fresh whipped cream.

It was everything I had hoped it would be and just slightly sweet (take it from a frappuccino-lover like me... there is no need to add sugar as it is perfect as is, especially when you mix in the whipped cream).
God, I hope Andytown franchises out into the Mission so I can go everyday.
Really loved this place.
snowy plover.author: Christina G.
snowy plover.review: My boyfriend and I came here after we put our name down at Outerlands for brunch.  I had heard the scones here were spectacular, but the muffins were calling my name.  The girl who helped us was so friendly and happy to be working there.  She noted that the strawberry corn muffins were still warm, which sealed the deal.  The muffin was indeed warm and freshly baked, crusty on the outside and moist on the inside - aided by fresh cut strawberries in the dough.  The atmosphere here was clean and modern, but there is limited seating and it is a small space.  The snowy plover was BEST THING EVER - espresso, San Pellegrino, fresh whipped cream.  It was everything I had hoped it would be and just slightly sweet (take it from a frappuccino-lover like me... there is no need to add sugar as it is perfect as is, especially when you mix in the whipped cream).  God, I hope Andytown franchises out into the Mission so I can go everyday.  Really loved this place.

excerpts: The coffee menu has the usual lattes and drip coffee, and unique options, like the Snowy Plover (espresso cream soda).
snowy plover.author: Sarah M.
snowy plover.review:
Great atmosphere, delicious food, and, most importantly, fantastic coffee. The shop is bright, clean, and simple, which makes it feel airy, even though it's a long and narrow space. There's a communal table in the front, small wall tables along the side (each with a plug below it), and outdoor seating in front of the shop.

The coffee menu has the usual lattes and drip coffee, and unique options, like the Snowy Plover (espresso cream soda). There's also non-coffee choices, such as hot cocoa and tea.

The food menu includes soda bread, scones, sausage rolls (highly recommended) and cookies.

The Sunset is lucky to have a coffee roaster, and a cafe that doesn't have the pretension of other coffee places in SF.

excerpts: The coffee I ordered was the Snowy Plover, sparkling soda with simple syrup, a shot of espresso and fresh whipping cream.
At first the taste leaves you a little confused, but in the best way possible.
It's like a Guinness with cream and without alcohol.
snowy plover.author: Monique K.
snowy plover.review:
Congratulations to Andytown on their opening! Can't wait to finish writing my thesis here  

The interior of this spot is absolutely gorgeous. Welcoming and bright, with a large communal table made with refinished wood, this spot practically begs you to talk to the super friendly and gorgeous owners while they make your cup of coffee. 

Speaking of coffee, the coffee is like another reviewer said, on par with Ritual and Four Barrel. Andytown is a serious new contender on the San Francisco coffee scene, and I can't wait to see how they grow and expand. 

The coffee I ordered was the Snowy Plover, sparkling soda with simple syrup, a shot of espresso and fresh whipping cream. At first the taste leaves you a little confused, but in the best way possible. It's like a Guinness with cream and without alcohol. Without a doubt, my number one recommendation. 

Anddddd they have wifi! Now I don't have to leave the outer sunset ever when I'm craving good coffee. (*^^*)

excerpts: Nearly a year after Andytown opened i finially made a point to stop in one day after picking my son up from school to try the Snowy Plover I'd heard so much about.
Made with Pelligrino, a brown sugar syrup, 2 shots of espresso over ice and topped with a generous serving of house made whipped cream
It reminded me of a float made with coffee ice cream so the "coffee float" descriptions are not far off.
I will make a point of visiting every week for my snowy plover though!
snowy plover.author: stephanie e.
snowy plover.review:
Nearly a year after Andytown opened i finially made a point to stop in one day after picking my son up from school to try the Snowy Plover I'd heard so much about.  Made with Pelligrino, a brown sugar syrup, 2 shots of espresso over ice and topped with a generous serving of house made whipped cream It reminded me of a float made with coffee ice cream so the "coffee float" descriptions are not far off.  The Plover is bes,t in my opinion, when you can really mix up the whipped cream into the drink - i found the tastiest plover I had was the one i poured into a bigger tumbler that allowed me more room to mix the drink up without splashing over.

the rest of the menu is minimal, but very good!  Aside from the standard coffee/espresso drinks, Andytown offers a selection of soda bread scones (savory/sweet) and cookies.

the menu itself is so minimalist as to almost be missed if you are short: its a stark white (to match the walls) in an austere sans serif font.

minimal seating inside at 3-4 small tables that seat 2, or folding cafe tables outside.  If you're lucky you will get a seat at the big square indoor table....that is, unless some technodouche had claimed the whole damn thing.

I will make a point of visiting every week for my snowy plover though!

excerpts: Love their Snowy Plover drink!
Bear a short wait in line for this delicious and refreshing coffee beverage.
They have decent options for breakfast / snack - scones, muffins, etc.
snowy plover.author: Meredith K.
snowy plover.review: Love their Snowy Plover drink!  Bear a short wait in line for this delicious and refreshing coffee beverage.  They have decent options for breakfast / snack - scones, muffins, etc.

excerpts: Get the snowy plover.
It sounds oddly enticing, and you will not be disappointed!
snowy plover.author: Beth B.
snowy plover.review: There is a bit of a line, but well worth the wait. Get the snowy plover. It sounds oddly enticing, and you will not be disappointed!

excerpts:
Came here for the Snowy Plover on a hot day and it was really refreshing.  
Also tried their mocha, latte and cappuccino.  
The plus is that they have almond milk!
snowy plover.author: Kei C.
snowy plover.review:
I've been here many times and Andytown never disappoint me.  Very friendly staffs!

I really love their muffins and scones.  My favorite is the strawberry corn muffin!
Came here for the Snowy Plover on a hot day and it was really refreshing.  
Also tried their mocha, latte and cappuccino.  
The plus is that they have almond milk!

excerpts: As a first-timer I ordered the Snowy Plover and this drink absolutely blew my mind!
The combination of the sparkling water, espresso and homemade whipped cream was such a treat... and not bad for being $4.
I didn't have much of a line, but it would be worth it even if there was one.
Hope they open shop in LA (like all the other coffee places have done)!
snowy plover.author: Jinny H.
snowy plover.review: Heard about this great coffee shop from a dear friend and was glad I was in the neighborhood on my day trip in SF. As a first-timer I ordered the Snowy Plover and this drink absolutely blew my mind! The combination of the sparkling water, espresso and homemade whipped cream was such a treat... and not bad for being $4. I didn't have much of a line, but it would be worth it even if there was one. Hope they open shop in LA (like all the other coffee places have done)!

excerpts: AND AND, TO TOP IT OFF, THE SNOWY PLOVER WAS WHAT
THE FREAK WOWZERZ CRAZY YUMMMZ.
Who woulda thought to mix sparkling water with espresso and homemade whipped cream?!
YUMYUM.
snowy plover.author: Kim N.
snowy plover.review:
WOWOOWOWOWOWOWW. EVERYTHING IS SOOOO DELIGHTFUL TO THE TASTE BUDS. The scones aren't drop dead amazing, but they're pretty yummy! The espresso was packed full of flavor as was the drip coffee! AND AND AND, TO TOP IT OFF, THE SNOWY PLOVER WAS WHAT THE FREAK WOWZERZ CRAZY YUMMMZ. Who woulda thought to mix sparkling water with espresso and homemade whipped cream?! YUMYUM. Perfect drink for the summer.. or well, any season really. 

Would drive from SJ to SF for this coffee ANYDAY.. if I had time! 

ALSO! ALSO! The store is decorated really cutely, and the staff were friendly friendly which is a plus plus!

excerpts: "SNOWY PLOVER!
My friend, Lyndon, brought me one to try
& I shared some with my friend, "Maria" First time to drink it
& now I'm totally Hooked.
snowy plover.author: Michelle Y.
snowy plover.review: "SNOWY PLOVER! " My friend, Lyndon, brought me one to try & I shared some with my friend, "Maria" First time to drink it & now I'm totally Hooked.

excerpts: The snowy plover is not the best coffee drink I've had, not the most interesting I've ever had, but it still might be my favorite coffee I've ever had.
That whipped cream is awesome!
snowy plover.author: Michael D.
snowy plover.review: The snowy plover is not the best coffee drink I've had, not the most interesting I've ever had, but it still might be my favorite coffee I've ever had.  That whipped cream is awesome!

excerpts: Snowy plover is nice, but don't eat it in the shade on a cold day.
snowy plover.author: Joseph B.
snowy plover.review:
This place has been a fantastic addition to the Sunset. It offers the best espresso drinks west of 19th avenue.  I often walk miles to go here, and am usually greeted by a line around the corner.  It is worth it!

Pretty color scheme and good use of wood in terms of the style.  The Andytown "A" sign is also tres beau. 

Snowy plover is nice, but don't eat it in the shade on a cold day.  Brrr!

Good seating options.  Inside there are mini tables and outside there are full tables.  Plus there are a couple of benches on the Lawton Street side. 

I liked the cafe that used to be here (Kalia's Coffee Corner/Buzz), but Andytown has actualized the corner's potential much more than the former cafe did.  It has become a good mix of traditional populist Irish Catholic SF, hipster, and yuppie techie.
