This cafe seems to have led to a nice renaissance on this block with a couple of likeminded neighbor businesses.  It bridges the gap between the Judah Trouble Coffee corridor and the Noriega Establish corridor. 

The regular coffee is good too.  Loved their cranberry scone as well. 

I don't think I ever got my free scone that I was entitled to for being one of the original Andytown crowdfunder donors though.  :-P

excerpts: Get the snowy plover, espresso, pellagrino, brown sugar, coffee cream..
snowy plover.author: Petri Y.
snowy plover.review:
Hipster coffee spot
Delicious drinks and homemade pastries
Get the snowy plover, espresso, pellagrino, brown sugar, coffee cream..= delicious!! 

A bit coffeeish, a bit fizzy like a soda, a bit creamy like a float....totally yummolocious. 

For 3.75 can't go wrong.

Will be back 4 sure.

excerpts: Ordered their infamous snowy plover which was... different.
It's a concoction of coffee with pellegrino and their homemade whipped cream which was the only thing I really enjoyed from this drink.
I'll stick to my usual soy lattes which they have nailed!
Yes! perfect foamy consistency for me and a 10/10 for taste and art
:) you'll find me as a regular at this place for sure!
snowy plover.author: Crystal L.
snowy plover.review:
how did I just come across this place?! best coffee spot in the sunset y'all! It's a cute little hipster shop which is my kind of vibe. I had my shiba with me that day and was told I couldn't have him inside (even though there was a sign on the door that I missed.. OOPS!), but they have outdoor seating so GOOD save andytown!

Ordered their infamous snowy plover which was... different. It's a concoction of coffee with pellegrino and their homemade whipped cream which was the only thing I really enjoyed from this drink. I'll stick to my usual soy lattes which they have nailed! Yes! perfect foamy consistency for me and a 10/10 for taste and art :) you'll find me as a regular at this place for sure!

excerpts: I was told I have to try the special next time... snowy Plover!
snowy plover.author: JC C.
snowy plover.review:
Must try when you are in the outer sunset area.

Latte - 5 stars
Service - 5 stars
Wait - 5 stars ( 4 ppl in front of me at 830am)

Parking is tricky especially with the construction materials company across the street.

I was told I have to try the special next time... snowy Plover!

I'll be back to try your scones too.

excerpts: But of course my favorite is their snowy plover which you absolutely must try.
snowy plover.author: Megan W.
snowy plover.review:
Okay let's just get this straight first: my absolute favorite coffee shop in all of San Francisco.

Given, Andytown is very close to my house, that does not sway my opinion at all. I would drive halfway across the city for this coffee. I consider myself fairly versed in espresso quality and have had almost all of their drinks. There is nothing bad I could say about any of them. But of course my favorite is their snowy plover which you absolutely must try. 

And as if their coffee didn't impress you, ALL of their baked goods are ridiculous. Like I didn't know soda bread could taste so good. And their muffins and scones are just to die for.

And so with delicious food and drinks and adorable decor I figured I wouldn't care if the service was bad or good. But somehow they managed to find the sweetest people to run this store. I literally went in to ask for a cup of water and despite their long line they still were very attentive and even bothered to ask how my day was. I don't think I've been to a coffee shop in San Francisco in which the cashier was so nice especially since I wasn't even ordering anything!

And so I don't usually post reviews about coffee shops as I don't typically feel so opinionated about them. But I just love Andytown so much I had to let the world know. Give it a try and maybe you'll love this place just as much as I do.

excerpts:
Snowy Plover a bird that this espresso drink is named after. 
Probably because of the fluffy plop of whipped cream, resting on top of iced S. Pellegrino, two shots of espresso and some sweetness. 
Mix that whipped cream all up into the drink and you'll be very happy. 
It's so good. 
I think I'll go back tomorrow. 
The soda bread, also very good.
snowy plover.author: Geordie E.
snowy plover.review:
Snowy Plover a bird that this espresso drink is named after. 
Probably because of the fluffy plop of whipped cream, resting on top of iced S. Pellegrino, two shots of espresso and some sweetness. 
Mix that whipped cream all up into the drink and you'll be very happy. 
It's so good. I think I'll go back tomorrow. 
The soda bread, also very good.

excerpts: good coffee and snowy plover (
sparkling water + espresso with dollop of whipped cream).
snowy plover.author: Linda T.
snowy plover.review:
Awesome coffee in a quiet neighborhood in the sunset.  tiny store front with cool seatings and outside tables.  they roast their own beans.  good coffee and snowy plover (sparkling water + espresso with dollop of whipped cream).  their corn muffins and scones are bomb as well!!

i love this new cafe!  i might just go there daily if i had the chance!

excerpts: The baristas behind the counter are helpful and can serve up a mean cup of coffee, but the Snowy Plover is why you want to swing by for a visit.
- Snowy Plover - Pretty cool concept and not a bad way to get your dose of caffeine.
snowy plover.author: Jaso N.
snowy plover.review:
Hip little joint to grab a coffee. Very small selection of drinks to choose from, which means that they'll pump out consistently proper drinks. The place can get busy sometimes, but the wait isn't bad at all. The baristas behind the counter are helpful and can serve up a mean cup of coffee, but the Snowy Plover is why you want to swing by for a visit. 

- Snowy Plover - Pretty cool concept and not a bad way to get your dose of caffeine. Grab one if you need to shake up your coffee routine, you may end up replacing your daily coffee w these - they're pretty good. 

Note: The cream is made in-house, go nuts and get a double dollop. 

They also have scones and muffins, if you wanted something to go w your drink. You can usually get in and out pretty quickly. The space is pretty limited, but it can be a decent place to catch up w a friend or even get some work done, if need be.

excerpts: If you are lucky enough to drop in the Snowy Plover is a must!
It's kinda like a coffee float with homemade fresh whip cream!
YUM!
The staff is so friendly!
If you're walking your doggy then they got something yummy for your four legged friend as well.
The place is impeccably clean!
You can smell the scones baking and the coffee brewing.
This place is a must!
snowy plover.author: Claudia C.
snowy plover.review:
One of the best coffee shops I've ever had the opportunity to go to. And I'm a coffee LOVER. If you are lucky enough to drop in the Snowy Plover is a must! It's kinda like a coffee float with homemade fresh whip cream!  YUM! 
 The staff is so friendly! If you're walking your doggy then they got something yummy for your four legged friend as well. 
The place is impeccably clean! You can smell the scones baking and the coffee brewing. This place is a must!

excerpts: Snowy plover is worth a try, the homemade whipped cream is addictive!
snowy plover.author: Aoibheann M.
snowy plover.review:
This place is totally amazing. Definitely the best coffee in the sunset, if not the whole city!

I love coming here on a Saturday morning and the line never bothers me. The long line is just true testament of how good this place is!

Snowy plover is worth a try, the homemade whipped cream is addictive! I was wondering had Michael and Lauren ever though about introducing a nitrogen brew?

Apart from the amazing coffee, the soda bread is a real seller for me. It's exactly how my grandmother made it and how my mom still makes it! And it is so hard to get proper 'northern Irish' soda bread in this city. 

Andytown is edgy, unique and ahead of the game in what it offers all round! Keep up the great work!

excerpts: The latte was also very decent, but it looks like the snowy plover (iced coffee with house whipped cream I think?)
Is their signature drink here.
The most noteworthy had to be the staff; they're so friendly!
And in a genuine-happy way.
I was sitting there for a bit and this grumpy man came in and wasn't what I would consider  to be polite, but the staff member kept up her good nature.
Kudos to her!
snowy plover.author: Loretta C.
snowy plover.review: Scone was yummy! (Omg, and now just got a whiff of freshly baked ones...mmmm) Had a nice crunch on the outside. The latte was also very decent, but it looks like the snowy plover (iced coffee with house whipped cream I think?) Is their signature drink here. The most noteworthy had to be the staff; they're so friendly! And in a genuine-happy way. I was sitting there for a bit and this grumpy man came in and wasn't what I would consider  to be polite, but the staff member kept up her good nature. Kudos to her!

excerpts: I tried my friend's Snowy Plover.
All I tasted was the sparkling water.
I mixed it and tried it again, but I still didn't really get the appeal.
If I'm looking for coffee in the area, I might come back.
snowy plover.author: Patrick M.
snowy plover.review:
Pretty average hipster coffee shop.  I ordered a drip coffee, only to find it was brewed in batch and held in a thermal dispenser as opposed to manually poured over like Blue Bottle.  The coffee was a solid medium roast, with a few fruity and acidic notes but lacked body.

I tried my friend's Snowy Plover.  All I tasted was the sparkling water.  I mixed it and tried it again, but I still didn't really get the appeal.  If I'm looking for coffee in the area, I might come back.

excerpts: I kept reading about the snowy plover on yelp
so I got one.
Damn that was a lot of whip cream they put in it
but it was delicious!
I would definitely get it as a treat again!
I also got a chocolate cherry scone, I mean how can that taste nasty?
It was good, not dry, flavorful buttery chocolatey.
snowy plover.author: Karen T.
snowy plover.review: I hate sour coffee, like blue bottle coffe. I had to ask the lady if it's sour, she gave me a taste and it was good. I kept reading about the snowy plover on yelp so I got one. Damn that was a lot of whip cream they put in it but it was delicious! I would definitely get it as a treat again! I also got a chocolate cherry scone, I mean how can that taste nasty? It was good, not dry, flavorful buttery chocolatey.

excerpts: In the beginning, I was hesitant about ordering the snowy plover, but what the heck -
I like strange combos.
snowy plover.author: Tammy S.
snowy plover.review:
This has to be my favorite coffee shop in San Francisco, hands down, let's just take a moment and give them a round of applause.

Okay - done? Cool.

In the beginning, I was hesitant about ordering the snowy plover, but what the heck - I like strange combos. I will say, it's an acquired taste and it takes some getting used to, but once you try it, you'll want it again and again, no matter what the weather! 

The crew always seems so nice and their setup is quick and efficient. Although there is limited seating, there is the beach nearby!

Thank you for extending your business hours until 5pm and finally opening on Mondays! I'm excited!

Andytown is also the only coffee shop that I ever feel like I want to give a tip to - and so, that says a lot!

excerpts: omg my best friend brought me here cause she loves the Snowy Plover
and she made me try hers
and it was SO WEIRD!
Not a big fan of carbonated espresso, LOVE the whipped cream though.
Anyway, I came here again recently cause I wanted coffee and I live close by.
I ordered a latte with almond milk and requested it to be "not too hot" and OMG IT WAS AMAZING!
This is the BEST "hot" coffee I've ever had, EVER!
It was very slightly sweet from the almond milk but not too bitter, just the way I like my coffee.
Usually it's either too sweet or too bitter and I have to add sugar
but then I feel bad for adding sugar.
But yeah, PERFECT HOT ALMOND LATTE.
I'm definitely coming back!
snowy plover.author: Stephanie Z.
snowy plover.review: omg my best friend brought me here cause she loves the Snowy Plover and she made me try hers and it was SO WEIRD! Not a big fan of carbonated espresso, LOVE the whipped cream though. Anyway, I came here again recently cause I wanted coffee and I live close by. I ordered a latte with almond milk and requested it to be "not too hot" and OMG IT WAS AMAZING! This is the BEST "hot" coffee I've ever had, EVER! It was very slightly sweet from the almond milk but not too bitter, just the way I like my coffee. Usually it's either too sweet or too bitter and I have to add sugar but then I feel bad for adding sugar. But yeah, PERFECT HOT ALMOND LATTE. I'm definitely coming back!

excerpts: I'm not a huge espresso drinker anymore, and prefer my coffee black, so while the Snowy Plover sounds good, it's not really my thing.
But that shouldn't stop you either.
In any case I am definitely a sweets person and that strawberry corn muffin was calling my name the minute I laid eyes on it.
In sitting and enjoying my food and beverage, space is definitely limited here, but the one thing I absolutely appreciated about Andytown was how many people call themselves a regular here.
The people behind the counter greeted each of their regular customers like old friends.
Nothing overly pretentious here, and definitely an environment that welcomes relaxers, families, or people stopping in for a breakfast item and coffee.
I wish I could come here more often!
The coffee was good, although I think our coffees were served a little too hot which made tasting it a little difficult.
That being said, this is definitely worth checking out if you're in the area.
snowy plover.author: Lisa I.
snowy plover.review: If you're only going to remember two things before going to Andytown, know this: Get the strawberry corn muffin and a coffee. I'm not a huge espresso drinker anymore, and prefer my coffee black, so while the Snowy Plover sounds good, it's not really my thing.  But that shouldn't stop you either.  In any case I am definitely a sweets person and that strawberry corn muffin was calling my name the minute I laid eyes on it.  In sitting and enjoying my food and beverage, space is definitely limited here, but the one thing I absolutely appreciated about Andytown was how many people call themselves a regular here.  The people behind the counter greeted each of their regular customers like old friends.  Nothing overly pretentious here, and definitely an environment that welcomes relaxers, families, or people stopping in for a breakfast item and coffee.  I wish I could come here more often! The coffee was good, although I think our coffees were served a little too hot which made tasting it a little difficult. That being said, this is definitely worth checking out if you're in the area.

excerpts: Have to give props to Nena L. for the tip on the Snowy Plover.
It was everything that it was described as being, delicious, somewhat sweet and sour at the same time, etc.
I got two
so I would have something to drink while walking to the beach.
I love the location not being too far from the N-line.
The place itself is cramped but the line moved a lot quicker than I would have thought.
The staff was polite and efficient
so i will have no problems heading out west to this place next time I'm in the city.
snowy plover.author: James R.
snowy plover.review: Have to give props to Nena L. for the tip on the Snowy Plover. It was everything that it was described as being, delicious, somewhat sweet and sour at the same time, etc. I got two so I would have something to drink while walking to the beach. I love the location not being too far from the N-line. The place itself is cramped but the line moved a lot quicker than I would have thought. The staff was polite and efficient so i will have no problems heading out west to this place next time I'm in the city.

excerpts: I think I'm sinning when I tell people I don't like the Snowy Plover.
Don't get me wrong, I love coffee and I crave it when I don't get my daily intake.
But personally, I like my espresso free of bubbles.

(Snowy Plover = 2 shots espresso + Pellegrino + brown sugar + homemade whipped cream)

Putting that aside
snowy plover.author: Ashley L.
snowy plover.review:
I think I'm sinning when I tell people I don't like the Snowy Plover. Don't get me wrong, I love coffee and I crave it when I don't get my daily intake. But personally, I like my espresso free of bubbles. (Snowy Plover = 2 shots espresso + Pellegrino + brown sugar + homemade whipped cream)

Putting that aside, I love their lattes. They're not the strongest, but they taste very well balanced. I don't have to add a single thing to it and it'll keep me going for a couple of hours.

Appreciate the outdoor seating, but it's still a challenge finding a spot. I only come here to meet up friends - not a place to study because of its size. A quick walk to the beach is always pleasant when Karl (the fog) isn't out. 

Make sure to check the opening hours, as they are limited. No minimum on card that I am aware of.

excerpts: Thank goodness the guy in front of me ordered the Snowy Plover
- I probably wouldnt have tried based on name alone, but it looked to SO delicious
and it was.
I had to stop myself from ordering a pastry
but I wil be back for one - perhaps after a nice long run in GGP beause balance makes life go 'round.
These guys roast their beans in house 3 times per week and my espresso almost tasted like a chocolate covered almond.
snowy plover.author: Aubrey O.
snowy plover.review: Yum! Yum! Yum!  Thank goodness the guy in front of me ordered the Snowy Plover - I probably wouldnt have tried based on name alone, but it looked to SO delicious and it was. I had to stop myself from ordering a pastry but I wil be back for one - perhaps after a nice long run in GGP beause balance makes life go 'round. These guys roast their beans in house 3 times per week and my espresso almost tasted like a chocolate covered almond.

excerpts: I always order the snowy plover and soda current scone, my morning ritual.
Great little coffee bar in the outer sunset!
snowy plover.author: Maggie M.
snowy plover.review: I always order the snowy plover and soda current scone, my morning ritual.  Great little coffee bar in the outer sunset!

excerpts: The snowy plover is delicious, but in a different way.
snowy plover.author: Jimbowicz J.
snowy plover.review:
The Outer Sunset waited a long time for a place like this. With their unique identity and extremely courteous service, it's become our favorite spot for a coffee drink and a snack. Their latte is hands down one of my top fives...ever!  The snowy plover is delicious, but in a different way. 

Now for their baked goods - the soda bread is absolutely fantastic. Add butter and raw cheddar, or jam, or do the seasonal special. You can't go wrong!  Their scones, muffins, and other goodies all a real treat too. You can't go wrong with this place!

Michael and his wife are very friendly and will have you feeling very welcomed. Stop by but only tell your good friends about this spot :)

excerpts: I caved in today and finally stopped by for a snowy plover.
It tasted... interesting?
For lack of a better word.
But I liked it!
If you're sensitive to dairy, be careful about the whipped cream--tasty but rich!
The line was horrendously long but moved fairly quickly, and the cashier was quick to answer any questions I had.
Great location (close to Ocean Beach), too!
snowy plover.author: Alexa A.
snowy plover.review: I caved in today and finally stopped by for a snowy plover. It tasted... interesting? For lack of a better word. But I liked it! If you're sensitive to dairy, be careful about the whipped cream--tasty but rich! The line was horrendously long but moved fairly quickly, and the cashier was quick to answer any questions I had. Great location (close to Ocean Beach), too!

excerpts: Usually I get their infamous snowy plover - sweet, delicious, and does it's job.
I bring my friends from out of town here pretty often, and they like their regular coffees and lattes.
I'm more keen to the pastries.
snowy plover.author: Kristine T.
snowy plover.review:
For someone who is not a coffee drinker, I love Andytown! The quality of their drinks and food as well and the quality of their service is the tops, and I'm so happy to have them as my neighborhood coffee spot.

Usually I get their infamous snowy plover - sweet, delicious, and does it's job. I bring my friends from out of town here pretty often, and they like their regular coffees and lattes. I'm more keen to the pastries. Their scones are to die for and their bread is extremely fresh and sells out  ridiculously fast. 

The vibe they set is welcoming and everyone who works there makes you feel right at home. They also have great wifi and tables to sit at if you need to do work. My only gripe is that there are no outlets at the big table so my work sessions are cut short, but i guess that means more people can enjoy Andytown. 

Definitely a go-to place in the Sunset!

excerpts: Everyone knows about the snowy plover but don't sleep on the caps and lattes.
I come here a lot!
Amazing coffee and super friendly staff.
The neighborhood go-to.
snowy plover.author: d n.
snowy plover.review: Everyone knows about the snowy plover but don't sleep on the caps and lattes. I come here a lot! Amazing coffee and super friendly staff. The neighborhood go-to.

excerpts: Wow, the snowy plover is the best espresso beverage that I've ever had in my life.
Can't wait to go back for more!
Really cute place and service was great.
snowy plover.author: Ariana V.
snowy plover.review: Wow, the snowy plover is the best espresso beverage that I've ever had in my life. Can't wait to go back for more! Really cute place and service was great.

excerpts: Really liked their Snowy Plover!
An iced drink with espresso and Pellegrino.
Just think of it like a carbonated cup of coffee.
It's actually quite a strong cup of coffee, but very unique.
It may sound a bit weird, but it was delicious!
But it might not be everyone's cup of coffee.
Not only does Andytown have drinks, they also have scones and muffins.
I've been here twice and tried a few of their pastries and my favorite is their Strawberry Corn Muffin.
I came here early enough in the morning to try it fresh out of the oven.
It's soft on the inside and crispy on the outside edges.
Just a heads-up, make sure to come early because they do sell out some of their popular muffins/scones fast.
Andytown is definitely worth a try!
snowy plover.author: Philana C.
snowy plover.review: Really liked their Snowy Plover! An iced drink with espresso and Pellegrino. Just think of it like a carbonated cup of coffee. It's actually quite a strong cup of coffee, but very unique. It may sound a bit weird, but it was delicious! But it might not be everyone's cup of coffee. Not only does Andytown have drinks, they also have scones and muffins. I've been here twice and tried a few of their pastries and my favorite is their Strawberry Corn Muffin. I came here early enough in the morning to try it fresh out of the oven. It's soft on the inside and crispy on the outside edges. Just a heads-up, make sure to come early because they do sell out some of their popular muffins/scones fast. Andytown is definitely worth a try! :)

excerpts: I've been wanting to try the snowy plover for a while.
I mean sparkling water + espresso + whipped cream...would these work together?
You can clearly taste the pellegrino in the coffee, and it seems like it wouldn't work
but it does.
This is a surprisingly delicious concoction.
Definitely a must try!
snowy plover.author: Tiffany C.
snowy plover.review: Amazing coffee.  I've been wanting to try the snowy plover for a while.  I mean sparkling water + espresso + whipped cream...would these work together?  You can clearly taste the pellegrino in the coffee, and it seems like it wouldn't work but it does. This is a surprisingly delicious concoction. Definitely a must try!

excerpts: Snowy Plover.
snowy plover.author: Chrisy C.
snowy plover.review:
Snowy Plover. That's all you need to know.

Okay and the baked goods are deeeeelicious. Everyone is so friendly. I love strolling over with my baby who gets plenty of attention and entertainment while we pay and wait for our goodies. Love the neighborhood vibe.

excerpts: For coffee, I got the snowy plover, which is like an espresso soda with whipped heavy cream on top.
Sounded very weird, and I was a little hesitant to try it, but it ended up being AMAZING.
Like, seriously one of the best coffee beverages I have ever had.
It's sort of like a coffee flavored homemade cream soda.
snowy plover.author: Jeff M.
snowy plover.review:
Holy crap what a find! We happened to be nearby and looking for coffee, and were lucky enough to stumble upon Andytown! We got coffee as well as some baked goods for breakfast. The muffins were delicious. Great flavor combinations, and very moist. For coffee, I got the snowy plover, which is like an espresso soda with whipped heavy cream on top. Sounded very weird, and I was a little hesitant to try it, but it ended up being AMAZING. Like, seriously one of the best coffee beverages I have ever had. It's sort of like a coffee flavored homemade cream soda. I wanted to get another one immediately.

This place goes to show that all those lists of "Best coffee shops in town" that keep listing the same places over and over again are far from exhaustive. I will definitely be back, hopefully sooner rather than later.

excerpts: Blue bottle has been my all time favorite for awhile in SF, but andytown really won me over with the snowy plover and delicious lattes and pastries.
The snowy plover is the way to go, even on a cold morning i enjoyed it, and i was really feeling something warm.
The concoction sounds so funky and strange that i almost didn't want to order it, afraid i would be dissapointed; but it works.
Perfect smooth coffee balance and flavor, and the dollop of heavy sweetened cream on top just makes this drink perfect to sip on!
Go for the snowy plover, for the win!  .
I will be back for more snowy plover, lattes, and delicious pastries :)
snowy plover.author: Terence N.
snowy plover.review:
Move over blue bottle, andytown is coming to town!  Blue bottle has been my all time favorite for awhile in SF, but andytown really won me over with the snowy plover and delicious lattes and pastries.

Stumbled upon andytown at the outskirts of town, and glad i made the choice to check out this coffee shop!   The snowy plover is the way to go, even on a cold morning i enjoyed it, and i was really feeling something warm.  The concoction sounds so funky and strange that i almost didn't want to order it, afraid i would be dissapointed; but it works.  Perfect smooth coffee balance and flavor, and the dollop of heavy sweetened cream on top just makes this drink perfect to sip on!  Go for the snowy plover, for the win!  .  

I also tried a latte, its stronger than most with nice coffee flavor, not too bitter.  They really know how to pull a nice shot.  Only wish my coffee art was perfected, guess they could work on their coffee art.  Blue bottle might still make a better latte only because they use richer whole milk, but its more personal preference.

The jalapeno cornbread muffin is good, but wished there was more jalapeno and cheese.  Its a rather larger muffin, big enough for two people to share.

Only downside is the place is really small and only a few small interior tables, not meant for sitting down to catch up with friends.  The line is long and wraps outside, so be prepared to wait.  This is more of a grab and go local coffee joint, but its the best in the sunset!  I will be back for more snowy plover, lattes, and delicious pastries :)

excerpts: Admittedly, I always order either a Snowy Plover or a latte, creature of habit, I am.
Let's talk about the Snowy Plover for a second - a shot of espresso over ice with Pellegrino and topped off with dollop of fresh whipped cream - are you kidding me?
The espresso is so balanced and even a tad sweet that you don't need sugar.
Completely mix in the whipped cream or not, it's the most perfect iced coffee.
snowy plover.author: Marie B.
snowy plover.review:
Comes to NO SURPRISE that Andytown has a five star rating!  Like not surprised at all because as far as I'm concerned Andytown is as good as it gets!

I've been to Andytown about a dozen times, and each time my drink and muffin on point and all served quickly by friendly baristas and staff.  Admittedly, I always order either a Snowy Plover or a latte, creature of habit, I am.  Let's talk about the Snowy Plover for a second - a shot of espresso over ice with Pellegrino and topped off with dollop of fresh whipped cream - are you kidding me?  The espresso is so balanced and even a tad sweet that you don't need sugar.  Completely mix in the whipped cream or not, it's the most perfect iced coffee.  The latte is great, too; perfect temperature and again so balanced that I only use one teaspoon of sugar whereas I would normally use 2 or 3 at other coffee houses.  

And the scones!  Savory or sweet, you can't go wrong with either. I often choose the gluten free option - which often is the strawberry corn muffin - and I love it.  Does not taste gluten free, texture is like any corn muffin, and berries are bursting out of the muffin. I especially enjoy it when it's still warm.

I don't get to Andytown often, but when I do, it brightens up my morning what with the delicious offerings and smiling staff. I arrive at work (after a 45 minute commute) with an empty coffee cup and nearly finished muffin, ready to start the work day.

excerpts: Went here to try their specialty, the Snowy Plover!
Espresso with sparkling water and yummy homemade whipped cream.
At first sip I thought the drink was a little weird, but as I kept drinking the more and more I liked it.
snowy plover.author: Annaliese D.
snowy plover.review:
Went here to try their specialty, the Snowy Plover! Espresso with sparkling water and yummy homemade whipped cream. At first sip I thought the drink was a little weird, but as I kept drinking the more and more I liked it. It's like a coffee soda.

The coffee shop is small, but cute. There are a few tables outside, a couple small tables along the wall and a communal table in the front corner. The scones and muffins look delicious and I'll have to come back to try them.

excerpts: The Snowy Plover has become my favorite here as it's a unique espresso drink that you can't find anywhere else.
Ask for extra whipped cream!
The drip coffee is very flavorful with strong notes of chocolate and red fruit.
They always have a nice assortment of yummy interesting pastries, today I tried the elderflower shortbread cookie and it was delicious.
I'm in love with the atmosphere, and the staff here is great too.
This is a busy place
but it's worth the wait!
snowy plover.author: Sophia S.
snowy plover.review: Andytown is a must whenever I come to SF. The Snowy Plover has become my favorite here as it's a unique espresso drink that you can't find anywhere else. Ask for extra whipped cream! The drip coffee is very flavorful with strong notes of chocolate and red fruit. They always have a nice assortment of yummy interesting pastries, today I tried the elderflower shortbread cookie and it was delicious. I'm in love with the atmosphere, and the staff here is great too. This is a busy place but it's worth the wait!

excerpts: The snowy plover is one of the greatest coffee drinks to be found anywhere.
Forgive Andytown's remote location, it is a very special place.
snowy plover.author: Sebastian M.
snowy plover.review: The snowy plover is one of the greatest coffee drinks to be found anywhere. Forgive Andytown's remote location, it is a very special place.

excerpts: Snowy plover for the win!!!!!!
I have never been so addicted to something soooo much!
I've lived 3 blocks away from Andytown almost all my life and have never tried it until one of my girlfriends mentioned the spot to me just the other day!
And boy ......
Since last week, I've been there 3x already
and I still wanted more!
Ive ordered the snowy plover and the cornbread muffin every time !!!
Its been amazing!
Service was great, food was great!
Must try!!!
You won't regret it!
snowy plover.author: Kelly C.
snowy plover.review: Snowy plover for the win!!!!!! I have never been so addicted to something soooo much! I've lived 3 blocks away from Andytown almost all my life and have never tried it until one of my girlfriends mentioned the spot to me just the other day! And boy ...... Since last week, I've been there 3x already and I still wanted more! Ive ordered the snowy plover and the cornbread muffin every time !!! Its been amazing! Service was great, food was great! Must try!!! You won't regret it!

excerpts: I have also had their famous snowy plover, but am not a huge fan of sweeter/coffee drinks.
Still a fabulous drink, but not my cup of tea.
snowy plover.author: Erik H.
snowy plover.review:
Im going to make a bold statement and say that Andytown is the best coffee shop I have been to in America...yes I really did say that!  I travel to SF about 3X a month and thanks to Andytown, I am on the hunt to find a coffee shop as good as this place in my hometown of Seattle...still searching as we speak.    

COFFEE:
This is literally one of the best tasting/roasts of coffee I have ever had.  I usually get an Americano or Cappucino.  Everytime I have been here, the coffee is consistent with flavor and temperature.  Their is always a nice film of natural coffee oils on top of my Americanos.  I have also had their famous snowy plover, but am not a huge fan of sweeter/coffee drinks.  Still a fabulous drink, but not my cup of tea.  Seriously the best Americano & Cappucino i have ever had though.

BAKED GOODS:
Their baked good are excellent!  Consistently fresh and tasty!  The last handful of times I went, I had their Apple & Pear Corn Muffin, Ginger scone w/Apricot Jam center and their Cheddar Scallion Scone.  All equally delicious, but I think I am more of a fan of their corn muffins.  

Great coffee shops.  There is usually a line outside, but well worth the wait.  Also, they're pretty quick making their drinks, so the wait isnt too bad.  I seriously look forward to my visits to SF knowing that Ill be having a cup of coffee at Andytown!

excerpts: I only tried the Snowy Plover
and I'm definitely gonna come back to try the other drinks.
The Snowy Plover is a combination of an espresso shot, Pellegrino, and cream.
If you don't like the taste of Pellegrino, you probably won't like it
your first try.
I really enjoyed it because the Pellegrino took away that weird film you get on your tongue after drinking coffee/dairy products.
Interesting combo but the Pellegrino made it very refreshing.
snowy plover.author: Fiona C.
snowy plover.review: I only tried the Snowy Plover and I'm definitely gonna come back to try the other drinks. The Snowy Plover is a combination of an espresso shot, Pellegrino, and cream. If you don't like the taste of Pellegrino, you probably won't like it your first try. I really enjoyed it because the Pellegrino took away that weird film you get on your tongue after drinking coffee/dairy products. Interesting combo but the Pellegrino made it very refreshing.

excerpts: Wow..you have to try the Snowy Plover it taste like coffee
but you feel like you are drinking a soda.
.outside

seating 
Be ready for a line
but it goes fast.
snowy plover.author: Joseph B.
snowy plover.review:
Wow..you have to try the Snowy Plover it taste like coffee but you feel like you are drinking a soda. .outside seating 
Be ready for a line but it goes fast.

excerpts: Since word in the Andytown is the Snowy Plover, I had to come try it for myself.

Snowy Plover (turns out it was named after a bird under Wildlife Protection, found this out as I was walking along the beach!) is an interesting invention: sparking water, espresso, whipped cream on top.
Never would I have thought that such a combination can work, but it does!
I can imagine how refreshing this concoction can be on a hot sunny day.
Unfortunately, the day I had the drink was rather cold, and it took me forever to drink, so the fizziness of the water was gone by the time I reached halfway.
snowy plover.author: Mandy C.
snowy plover.review:
Since word in the Andytown is the Snowy Plover, I had to come try it for myself.

Snowy Plover (turns out it was named after a bird under Wildlife Protection, found this out as I was walking along the beach!) is an interesting invention: sparking water, espresso, whipped cream on top. Never would I have thought that such a combination can work, but it does! I can imagine how refreshing this concoction can be on a hot sunny day. Unfortunately, the day I had the drink was rather cold, and it took me forever to drink, so the fizziness of the water was gone by the time I reached halfway. I recommend downing it as fast as possible!

Meanwhile, the raspberry and blackberry cornbread was absolutely delicious, and something that I would definitely get whenever I visit here. Cornbread and a warm cup of latte = perfect combination.

I do wish the place was bigger though. It isn't really a working/ studying-friendly coffee shop (only one medium sized table out in the front where you can awkwardly sit as people line up around it to get their caffeine fix). Thus, I suggest a nice long walk along the beach to accompany your coffee instead :)

excerpts: I tried their signature drink, Snowy plover.
The drink was expresso with carbonated water.
It tasted something different.
I also ordered a scone.
It was so good and BIG.
snowy plover.author: Liza T.
snowy plover.review: First time came here and I loved it.  I tried their signature drink, Snowy plover.  The drink was expresso with carbonated water.  It tasted something different.  I also ordered a scone.  It was so good and BIG.

excerpts: The baked goods & Snowy Plover, their coffee soda with whipped cream, appear to be popular.
snowy plover.author: Deb L.
snowy plover.review:
Good service. Line out the door at 2 pm on Saturday, but it moved quickly. Cafe is cute & close to Ocean Beach. The baked goods & Snowy Plover, their coffee soda with whipped cream, appear to be popular. 

But I was in search of a good espresso or Americano, and was disappointed with what I was served, doubly so because I had high hopes since this place roasts its own beans and one of the founders was a head barista at Blue Bottle. The espresso was very bitter and burnt tasting - overextracted, perhaps? They don't know how to make an Americano properly. The guy put the espresso in the cup first, then poured boiling water (too hot!) over it, destroying the crema. Still in search of a good espresso and Americano, with good taste, good crema, and coffee that stands on its own without sugar, milk, soda water or whipped cream.

excerpts: The Snowy Plover is real.
The scone & cornbread muffin were also very nice.
I like the spot and the servers were very friendly.
snowy plover.author: Ameer N.
snowy plover.review: The Snowy Plover is real. The scone & cornbread muffin were also very nice. I like the spot and the servers were very friendly.

excerpts: I got a snowy plover per my friends request because she says "I don't know if I hate it or love it".
I believe the snowy plover is coffee with Pellegrino and creme fraiche on top.
Sounds weird but has an interesting taste, I am now at that crossroads as my friend.
I can't tell if I love it or hate it.
It's good
but when you first sip it you get the Pellegrino carbonation which is just interesting in a coffee drink.
The coffee in the snowy plover was delicious
so I would definitely go back to try a coffee and soda bread with cheddar and bacon.
snowy plover.author: Rebecca M.
snowy plover.review: This place is super cute. It's a small corner cafe, and when I say small I mean small. I think maybe 15 people can sit in there. Their pastries looked delicious and the soda bread that you can add cheddar and bacon too sounded bomb. I got a snowy plover per my friends request because she says "I don't know if I hate it or love it". I believe the snowy plover is coffee with Pellegrino and creme fraiche on top. Sounds weird but has an interesting taste, I am now at that crossroads as my friend. I can't tell if I love it or hate it. It's good but when you first sip it you get the Pellegrino carbonation which is just interesting in a coffee drink. The coffee in the snowy plover was delicious so I would definitely go back to try a coffee and soda bread with cheddar and bacon.

excerpts: Snowy Plover, try it.
It is bubbly like a coffee soda, the perfect dollop of cream, the slight salty/sour fizzy water.
I could drink this all day (in the summer).
snowy plover.author: Subie C.
snowy plover.review:
The lines have gotten ridiculous. When we first started frequenting Andytown, we felt like we were stopping by a neighborhood spot. Now we often get deterred when we drive by and see the line waaay out the door. 

But, it is still my favorite, so it deserves the 5 stars. Take over a larger space. Or open a 2nd location -- like on my street.  

Coffee- Snowy Plover, try it. It is bubbly like a coffee soda, the perfect dollop of cream, the slight salty/sour fizzy water. I could drink this all day (in the summer). The lattes are also wonderful. 

Food -- amazing. The beautiful seasonal artisan muffins. The buttery and flakey sausage roll. The soda bread topped with bacon. 

The store is understated perfect. The FLOWERS the flowers - kudos mystery flora hobbyist friend of Andytown. The reclaimed wood table. The beautiful mugs and wood blocks they send their food out on. Free wifi but minimal seating. Went on a Friday to do work, there was nowhere to park. If it's a warm day, though, there are tables at the side of the building which you can also bring your pup to. 

Oh and the people are just marvelous. Super kind. Very patient. Very knowledgable. Very cool. Very friendly.

excerpts: The staff were all friendly, the snowy plover was conceptually strange but delicious (will definitely be coming back for this)!
I also had their pear and jam cornbread which was probably the best cornbread snack I've ever had.
All in all, great spot to do work accompanied with great coffee and snacks.
snowy plover.author: Zara F.
snowy plover.review: I was looking for a coffee shop to explore in the city, and considering how beautiful the day was, I wanted to stay in the outer sunset area to be near home and near the beach. Upon a quick yelp search, the solid rating and reviews brought my attention to andytown roasters and it did not disappoint me at all. The staff were all friendly, the snowy plover was conceptually strange but delicious (will definitely be coming back for this)! I also had their pear and jam cornbread which was probably the best cornbread snack I've ever had. All in all, great spot to do work accompanied with great coffee and snacks. 5-5.

excerpts: if you haven't tried their snowy plover, you're missing out in life.
snowy plover.author: C C.
snowy plover.review:
if you haven't tried their snowy plover, you're missing out in life. 

in general, if you haven't tried this delicious establishment, you are missing out. their coffee is honestly the best I've had. i am no coffee connoisseur but I'd like to think I know what I like and what tastes good.

excerpts: The snowy plover has changed my life and combined my love for coffee, sweets, and bubbles all in one delicious drink!
snowy plover.author: Krystal L.
snowy plover.review: Oh Andytown how I love thee!  The snowy plover has changed my life and combined my love for coffee, sweets, and bubbles all in one delicious drink!

excerpts: The Snowy Plover ($4) is also a fun drink if you're looking for something special and out of the ordinary!
snowy plover.author: Maci B.
snowy plover.review:
Andytown makes iced mochas ($4.75) just the way I like them (bittersweet, actually espresso-y) and they also happen to make the best whipped cream ever. I eat most of it off the top of my drink every time... it's just so good. 

The Snowy Plover ($4) is also a fun drink if you're looking for something special and out of the ordinary!  

Also, the people that work here are super friendly. Win win.

excerpts: The snowy plover is everything that everyone talks it up to be.
An innovative gift to coffee and those who enjoy a sweet treat from time to time.
The management is amazing, with community and sustainability in mind while maintaining excellent quality, and they're always friendly!
Top notch
I dare say, top notch!
snowy plover.author: David H.
snowy plover.review:
Andytown is top notch! Everything is delicious! The snowy plover is everything that everyone talks it up to be. An innovative gift to coffee and those who enjoy a sweet treat from time to time. 
The management is amazing, with community and sustainability in mind while maintaining excellent quality, and they're always friendly!
Top notch I dare say, top notch!

excerpts: Snowy plover".
This is the biggest joke ever.
Espresso and syrup, poured over ice, topped with sweetened whipped cream.
snowy plover.author: L Stephanie L.
snowy plover.review:
"Snowy plover". This is the biggest joke ever. Espresso and syrup, poured over ice, topped with sweetened whipped cream. Oh, forgot the worst part - fucking Pellegrino. 

(The baristas were nice.)

excerpts: I've been to Andytown three times and have tried the snowy plover, latte, and mocha.

At first I was hesitant to try a drink that was a mixture sparkling water and espresso (hmmm coffee soda, really?), but it just works (did I mention the spoonfuls of whipped cream that comes with the drink?!).
Props to them for the creativity.
The latte and mocha were also brilliantly crafted.
The strawberry corn muffin was not bad either-- wouldn't say it's amazing though.
snowy plover.author: Annie C.
snowy plover.review:
If I could grab all the stars in the sky and use it to rate the whipped cream at Andytown-- I would do so faster than you can say coffee. There's just something so magical about their whipped cream that, upon first taste, all dreams of dieting, eating healthy, and working out are diminished.

I've been to Andytown three times and have tried the snowy plover, latte, and mocha. At first I was hesitant to try a drink that was a mixture sparkling water and espresso (hmmm coffee soda, really?), but it just works (did I mention the spoonfuls of whipped cream that comes with the drink?!). Props to them for the creativity. The latte and mocha were also brilliantly crafted. The strawberry corn muffin was not bad either-- wouldn't say it's amazing though.  All in all, you will not be disappointed (except for the fact that close at 3PM).

Wake up. Drank. (coffee, that is.)

excerpts: Once you've had the Snowy Plover, forget other fancy drinks.
Nothing compares to how delicious this drink can be.
I was not overly awed by their drip coffee in the beginning, but the Snowy Plover impressed me.
I'm not always a fan of sweet coffee drinks, but the whipped cream that's put on top is addictive.
The Pellegrino with espresso made for an interesting experience.
The bitter taste of coffee along with the fizz of the sparkling water and then the sweetness of the cream leads your tongue to wonder what it's tasting.
So just order and try it.
snowy plover.author: Karen L.
snowy plover.review: Once you've had the Snowy Plover, forget other fancy drinks.  Nothing compares to how delicious this drink can be.  I was not overly awed by their drip coffee in the beginning, but the Snowy Plover impressed me.  I'm not always a fan of sweet coffee drinks, but the whipped cream that's put on top is addictive.  The Pellegrino with espresso made for an interesting experience.  The bitter taste of coffee along with the fizz of the sparkling water and then the sweetness of the cream leads your tongue to wonder what it's tasting.  So just order and try it.

excerpts: I also tried my friend's Snowy Plover, because we couldn't come here and not order that considering all the hype it gets.
It was quite an interesting experience...
I can appreciate it, it's special and I would order it myself when I return.
I was expecting it to be a lot sweeter than it was, however it was still refreshing and delicious none the less.
snowy plover.author: Christina L.
snowy plover.review:
"I feel so hipster"

The words we both uttered as we crossed the threshold of Andytown Coffee Roasters.

Parking: Super easy we parked right in front on a Sunday afternoon about 1 pm

Ambiance: clean and casual 

Coffee:  I just ordered a black coffee cause I'm a bad a$$ and don't take no creamers
and plus that's how you can tell if you have good coffee or not...and yes this is GREAT COFFEE. I was hungover and this kept me awake and alert the remainder of the evening. 

Price: Definitely more than I'd like to spend on one coffee, but I was not in the mood for sad watery SBux coffee even though this is easily twice the price. 

I also tried my friend's Snowy Plover, because we couldn't come here and not order that considering all the hype it gets.  It was quite an interesting experience...I can appreciate it, it's special and I would order it myself when I return.  I was expecting it to be a lot sweeter than it was, however it was still refreshing and delicious none the less.  The carbonation and the cream mix together to form a magical experience that any appreciator of coffee would enjoy. 

Do get caffeinated here!

excerpts: The Snowy Plover.
I had heard about this crazy drink of sparkling water, espresso and whipped cream and knew I had to try it...
and I definitely did.
snowy plover.author: Kimberly F.
snowy plover.review:
A cute coffee shop in the Sunset, just what the neighborhood needs. :)

What sets this place apart aside from it's various muffins and pastries is one drink in particular. The Snowy Plover. I had heard about this crazy drink of sparkling water, espresso and whipped cream and knew I had to try it... and I definitely did. While I can't say I'd order it again, it was definitely a unique, fun, and sweet (I normally just drink black coffee) drink.

I also tried the cornmeal muffin because it was fresh out of the oven and it was delicious. Now, just give me some butter and it might take it to another level.

excerpts: For those who are unsure about trying the Snowy Plover: it's pretty much coffee soda.
Like, Sprite without the taste of lemon-lime-sugar, and with the taste of bold, dark espresso.
(Which is what it literally is - Pellergino, shot of espresso, and homemade whipped cream).
You might grimace when you first try it, but it'll make sense.
snowy plover.author: Bobby W.
snowy plover.review:
When I first heard about this place, I was sentimentally biased against it, since, well, before Andytown, there was another coffee shop here which donated a lot to my local elementary school just down the block. Sad to see it go...

...but glad to see that it's been replaced by a great new coffee shop! Staff is super friendly (they even rapped a little when I asked for a business card) and really know the menu. Baked goods are phenomenal - and fresh out of the oven for most of the day. Coffee beans are roasted; by far some of the coffee drinks I've ever had. For those who are unsure about trying the Snowy Plover: it's pretty much coffee soda. Like, Sprite without the taste of lemon-lime-sugar, and with the taste of bold, dark espresso. (Which is what it literally is - Pellergino, shot of espresso, and homemade whipped cream). You might grimace when you first try it, but it'll make sense. It always does. 

Bonus points: dinosaurs in the potted plants. I'll be back.

excerpts: Kevin our barista was amazing and patient in helping us out and explaining what they had to offer we ended up opting for a snowy plover a tea au lait and a wheaten bread with seasonal spread everything was wonderful.
snowy plover.author: Andrew L.
snowy plover.review:
Went here again to introduce my friend to the amazingness that is andytown. Kevin our barista was amazing and patient in helping us out and explaining what they had to offer we ended up opting for a snowy plover a tea au lait and a wheaten bread with seasonal spread everything was wonderful. Always packed but always worth the wait. 

Thanks so much to Kevin and andytown for a wonderful experience.

excerpts: Snowy Plover and a warm strawberry corn muffin, warm and frequent(!) sunshine balancing the cool winds of the Pacific rolling up the block
and you have my favorite coffee shop in San Francisco.
Great interior design too.
This place has made the Sunset a destination for many non-surfers (along with Devil's Teeth and Outerlands).
snowy plover.author: Rob P.
snowy plover.review: Snowy Plover and a warm strawberry corn muffin, warm and frequent(!) sunshine balancing the cool winds of the Pacific rolling up the block and you have my favorite coffee shop in San Francisco.  Great interior design too.  This place has made the Sunset a destination for many non-surfers (along with Devil's Teeth and Outerlands).

excerpts: The best item in their menu would be the Snowy Plover, which is pretty much a sparkling coffee float with fresh whip cream on top.
It's a cute little shop that has seating indoors and outside.
The tables are decorated with beautiful plants and flowers.
The baristas are super friendly too!
There will always be a line
but it's worth the wait!
snowy plover.author: Lisa H.
snowy plover.review: The sunset district in San Francisco is where all the hidden gems are located. This place is beyond amazing. The scones and pastries are little bites of heaven. The coffee should be given some credit too. The best item in their menu would be the Snowy Plover, which is pretty much a sparkling coffee float with fresh whip cream on top. It's a cute little shop that has seating indoors and outside. The tables are decorated with beautiful plants and flowers. The baristas are super friendly too! There will always be a line but it's worth the wait!

excerpts: They even make a vegan version of the Snowy Plover by making it with almond milk & leave off the whipped cream (which I know is a big part of the drink, but it was really good w/o).
snowy plover.author: Lisa M.
snowy plover.review:
Coffee is great. They even make a vegan version of the Snowy Plover by making it with almond milk & leave off the whipped cream (which I know is a big part of the drink, but it was really good w/o).

(wish they had soy milk instead of just almond- almond milk covers up the taste of the coffee more than soy milk does).

Super happy they offer wifi, because that seems to be hard to find at specialty coffee shops, which I get, but someone's gotta do it!  There has to be SoMe place you can go to study/work and also enjoy GREAT coffee.

Atmosphere is nice. Clean. Bright. Positive. Modern.

They have gluten free baked goodies sometimes, which is great because my hubby has Celiac's disease.  However....1 vegan goody option would be great so I don't have to sneak my own in ; )

excerpts: SNOWY PLOVER!!!
the first time i tried it
I thought it was gross because i didn't mix it..
snowy plover.author: Judy C.
snowy plover.review: SNOWY PLOVER!!! the first time i tried it I thought it was gross because i didn't mix it..

excerpts: Had a Snowy Plover with extra whip and a cheddar scallion scone.
I have to say that simple as it was, it had to have been one of the best breakfasts I have had in a while.
Only downside was that seating is very, very limited.
snowy plover.author: Jiki B.
snowy plover.review: Love local businesses like these!  Smaller menu of beverage offerings than typical chain coffee places but I prefer it that way.  Sweet and savory scones fresh out of the oven.  Had a Snowy Plover with extra whip and a cheddar scallion scone. I have to say that simple as it was, it had to have been one of the best breakfasts I have had in a while. Only downside was that seating is very, very limited.

excerpts: The short version is that their Snowy Plover, scones, staff, owners, and space are AMAZING.
snowy plover.author: Crystal S.
snowy plover.review:
I would argue they changed my life, but that is a long story. 

The short version is that their Snowy Plover, scones, staff, owners, and space are AMAZING. If you believe in good aura, they have tons of it and it radiates from their coffee shop. 

Things that may be good to know in advance:
-limited seating inside
-free wifi (just ask!)
-lines on weekends
-limited hours

excerpts: Try the Snowy Plover.
It is divine and is easily one of my favorite drink concoctions.
Get a Snowy Plover and use it's whip on their heart shape cacao nib cookie.
snowy plover.author: Abe F.
snowy plover.review:
Legit coffee in Outer Sunset.  Try the Snowy Plover.  It is divine and is easily one of my favorite drink concoctions.  It will be yours too.

They have fantastic home made goods such as cheddar scallion scones, blueberry muffins, and sausage rolls.  I love the soda bread with added cheddar & bacon.  My favorite in house item is their whip cream actually.  Get a Snowy Plover and use it's whip on their heart shape cacao nib cookie.

Besides their food offerings, it's the little things in their shop that keeps me coming back.  The flowers they put into their little table vases are always stunning.  The big windows that look out into Lawton, where a plethora of dogs wait outside for their masters.  The handy bicycle pump that's free to use for their 2-wheeled patrons.

I don't know how to end this review.  So this is the end.

excerpts: I went on my own today and I ordered the Snowy Plover like everyone else in line.
snowy plover.author: Andrea S.
snowy plover.review:
I came with a friend last week who always orders Mochas when we have coffee together.  Although I usually order Americanos, today I ordered a Mocha, same as she.  I thought it was amazing, and she said it was the best Mocha she's had.

I went on my own today and I ordered the Snowy Plover like everyone else in line.  OMG, that was the best iced drink I have ever had.  

I love this place!

excerpts: I thought the concept for the Snowy Plover was interesting.
It's basically a coffee cream soda
Personally I wasn't a big fan
but it is worth a try.
snowy plover.author: Aaron C.
snowy plover.review: I thought the concept for the Snowy Plover was interesting. It's basically a coffee cream soda Personally I wasn't a big fan but it is worth a try.

excerpts: My faves drinks are the Almond Latte w/syrup and Snowy Plover.
And as for baked dough, definitely their cheese scallion scone and Asparagus Goat Cheese scone.
I come here on a weekly basis and the goods never fail!
snowy plover.author: Dee T.
snowy plover.review: I'm officially obsessed with everything this corner coffee shop has to offer! Friendly staff, clean cafe, super yummy coffee and baked goods!!! My faves drinks are the Almond Latte w/syrup and Snowy Plover. And as for baked dough, definitely their cheese scallion scone and Asparagus Goat Cheese scone. I come here on a weekly basis and the goods never fail!

excerpts: The Snowy Plover is just as good as everyone says it is, if not better.
I'm a sucker for coffee but an even more so for cute coffee shops and this place was everything I love.
Though it is a bit small inside, it's still a great spot.
The baristas are all fairly kind and it has a cozy feel indoors.
snowy plover.author: Natasha S.
snowy plover.review:
The Snowy Plover is just as good as everyone says it is, if not better. I'm a sucker for coffee but an even more so for cute coffee shops and this place was everything I love. Though it is a bit small inside, it's still a great spot. The baristas are all fairly kind and it has a cozy feel indoors. You can count on me to be back plenty more times.

My only downfall is that this place is closed on Mondays and closes at 3pm other days.

excerpts: And if you're feeling adventurous, their special drink is the "Snowy Plover" - espresso with soda water topped with house made whipped cream.
It's like a fizzy latte and the whipped cream is just to die for!
snowy plover.author: Sharon L.
snowy plover.review:
Lovely little café in the outer sunset. 
Super friendly staff that make great coffee and pastries! 
My go-to spot to pick up a latte and muffin to start my day off right!

Can't go wrong with an almond milk latte and strawberry corn muffin! The cheddar corn jalapeño muffin is yummy too! 

And if you're feeling adventurous, their special drink is the "Snowy Plover" - espresso with soda water topped with house made whipped cream. It's like a fizzy latte and the whipped cream is just to die for!

excerpts: I ordered the Snowy Plover.
I took one sip and all I have to say was WOWZA!.
It was so effervescent and refreshing
, it was a party in my mouth.
A Snowy Plover is a coffee cream soda that consists of ice, sparkling water, a shot of espresso, a spoonful of magical syrup and a dollop of heavenly cream.
snowy plover.author: Loun P.
snowy plover.review:
It's is a great spot for coffee lovers. I waited for them to open after they started a kickstarter campaign. It was worth the wait!

When I arrived there was this amazing smell of warm fresh baked goods baking in the oven.  I asked the gentleman behind the counter what is that amazing smell and he said it was the cheddar and scallion scone. Boy was that tasty! I also ordered the strawberry muffin and it was delicious. As you can tell, I have a pastry addiction.

 I ordered the Snowy Plover.I took one sip and all I have to say was WOWZA!. It was so effervescent and refreshing, it was a party in my mouth. A Snowy Plover is a coffee cream soda that consists of ice, sparkling water, a shot of espresso, a spoonful of magical syrup and a dollop of heavenly cream. 

The friendly staff is always welcoming and friendly. Also they take credit cards as well as Square wallet app which is great when I go for a jog and don't carry my wallet.

excerpts: When I feel a bit more indulgent, I go for the Snowy Plover.
I never knew how good an espresso x sparkling water concoction could be.
I shamelessly tried to replicate it
and I am embarrassed to say it did not go well.
Their secret might be their quality ingredients or homemade whipped cream.
Either way, Andytown has me hooked and is my favorite coffee shop in the neighborhood.
snowy plover.author: Renee L.
snowy plover.review:
One day, I was out on errands when my sister texted me to go get her some coffee from the newly opened Andytown.  I said, heck no, I aint your maid, go get it yourself.  A few days later, I dropped in for coffee and I have since regretted not coming in earlier.

I love Andytown! Their espresso makes me think to myself, what a wonderful world...cue Louis Armstrong.  When I feel a bit more indulgent, I go for the Snowy Plover.  I never knew how good an espresso x sparkling water concoction could be.  I shamelessly tried to replicate it and I am embarrassed to say it did not go well.  Their secret might be their quality ingredients or homemade whipped cream.  Either way, Andytown has me hooked and is my favorite coffee shop in the neighborhood.

excerpts: The real highlight amongst everything is the Snowy Plover, a delicious refreshing iced coffee soda.
snowy plover.author: Patrick O.
snowy plover.review: So many things to love about this place. Awesome staff, delicious coffee, the soda farls are delicious and a real taste of home. The real highlight amongst everything is the Snowy Plover, a delicious refreshing iced coffee soda.

excerpts: I tried the snowy plover because it looked so good but had no idea what was in it since the menu is non-descriptive
so I asked the barista who said it was amazing.
snowy plover.author: Anastasia P.
snowy plover.review:
You can't go wrong with a cup of coffee and one of their scones. I tried the snowy plover because it looked so good but had no idea what was in it since the menu is non-descriptive so I asked the barista who said it was amazing. It was a mixture of a latte and sparkling water topped with whipped cream..what a strange concoction. 

I do love their pastries the most though. It's usually different types every time I go in so it can be hit or miss depending on how picky you are. 

Overall it's really cute. I'm glad that the random residential block it's on is shaping up.

excerpts: Had a snowy plover (espresso, brown sugar simple syrup, soda water,  and a generous plop of homemade whipped cream) that made me very happy even on a cold rainy day.
Next time in back in SF I might trek back out to the outer sunset again for one!
snowy plover.author: Lisa B.
snowy plover.review: Playing tourist in my old neighborhood and found this place had popped up. Had a snowy plover (espresso, brown sugar simple syrup, soda water,  and a generous plop of homemade whipped cream) that made me very happy even on a cold rainy day.  Next time in back in SF I might trek back out to the outer sunset again for one!

excerpts: the snowy plover is my new favorite thing in life!
think root beer float except its espresso in soda water, simple syrup and house made super thick, luscious whipped cream.
i'm thoroughly loving this concoction of perfection.
snowy plover.author: Regina C.
snowy plover.review:
the snowy plover is my new favorite thing in life! think root beer float except its espresso in soda water, simple syrup and house made super thick, luscious whipped cream. i'm thoroughly loving this concoction of perfection. also, the cornmeal strawberry muffin was great and the sausage roll (albeit a tad too salty) is an excellent version of a pig in a blanket. 

the guy who was manning the cash register as well as making the drinks was extra friendly and has already gotten to know his regular customers by name. the interior is simple with accents of wood, lavender type plants and filament lights. i love this place and intend on frequenting it!

excerpts: Snowy plover is awesome if you have never tried.

snowy plover.review:

Tips:

Line moves faster than it seems.

excerpts: The Snowy Plover is so good!

Just went there today and excited for my next Snowy Plover!
snowy plover.author: Amy X.
snowy plover.review: Oh my gosh. The Snowy Plover is so good! I've never tried anything quite like this. I came here right after lunch so I was too full to try their delicious looking soda scones. But for sure next time! Just went there today and excited for my next Snowy Plover!

excerpts: Snowy Plover - Don't worry about feeling silly saying that out loud.

snowy plover.author: Kameron V.
snowy plover.review:
Snowy Plover - Don't worry about feeling silly saying that out loud. I never would have thought these ingredient went well together but it's completely divine. Coffee lovers and those who are more indifferent about coffee could probably agree that this is a wonderful treat.

Friendly staff, great location away from the hustle and bustle. The shop is a bit small but there is outdoor seating. Overall a great place to bring a friend to catch up or a place to be a loner.

Friendly vibe and great coffee drinks - what else do you need?

excerpts: I came to Andytown after I read about the Snowy Plover on Yelp.
I haven't tried their other drinks but the pastries and Snowy Plover are both very good.
snowy plover.author: Thatcher H.
snowy plover.review:
Finally ... a coffee shop gem has opened in Outer Sunset! 

I came to Andytown after I read about the Snowy Plover on Yelp. I haven't tried their other drinks but the pastries and Snowy Plover are both very good. 

Andytown is a small place so it's more of a place to pick up something and go before you hit the beach or get your day started.

excerpts: But we were both so ecstatic about the Snowy Plover.
So flipping good.
My sister was frightened by the whole club soda + espresso thing
but when she tried mine she regretted not getting one herself.
Don't be frightened, drink Snowy Plovers.
Wish we had an Andytown in So.
Cal-
I'd be there daily!
snowy plover.author: Ashley A.
snowy plover.review: Ok seriously. Best shot of espresso I've ever had in my LIFE- it was thick and sweet and smooth and so delicious (my sister got espresso con pana, which I tasted). But we were both so ecstatic about the Snowy Plover. So flipping good. My sister was frightened by the whole club soda + espresso thing but when she tried mine she regretted not getting one herself. Don't be frightened, drink Snowy Plovers. Wish we had an Andytown in So.Cal- I'd be there daily!

excerpts: The Snowy Plover is a must try at Andytown.
It always hits the spot on a warm and sunny SF afternoon.
Pellegrino, espresso, brown sugar, and topped with homemade whipped cream make this iced drink a constant go-to.
I have yet to find another iced coffee beverage that tops this one and whenever I'm in the area I have to get my snowy plover fix.
snowy plover.author: Irene M.
snowy plover.review: The Snowy Plover is a must try at Andytown. It always hits the spot on a warm and sunny SF afternoon. Pellegrino, espresso, brown sugar, and topped with homemade whipped cream make this iced drink a constant go-to. I have yet to find another iced coffee beverage that tops this one and whenever I'm in the area I have to get my snowy plover fix.

excerpts: Beautiful ambiance, friendly service, and the snowy plover is beyond compare.
I love the simple outdoor seating, and all of the baked goods!
The soda bread toast is one of my favorites, and I like to add the cheese or bacon on top.
Love having this place in the sunset!
snowy plover.author: Kira M.
snowy plover.review: Beautiful ambiance, friendly service, and the snowy plover is beyond compare. I love the simple outdoor seating, and all of the baked goods! The soda bread toast is one of my favorites, and I like to add the cheese or bacon on top. Love having this place in the sunset!

excerpts: and I decided to come check out the snowy plover.
We both agreed that they weren't the best because the coffee was on the sour side, but mixing the cream in made the drink a bit better.
snowy plover.author: Tiffany W.
snowy plover.review:
Very cute and nicely designed coffee corner!

A friend and I decided to come check out the snowy plover. We both agreed that they weren't the best because the coffee was on the sour side, but mixing the cream in made the drink a bit better. I don't think I'll be trying another anytime soon, but I would love to check out the other flavors as they do roast their own coffee.

We also tried a plum mint scone, and it was really good! Fresh from the oven, the scone wasn't too sweet and had the perfect combination of plum and mint.

I appreciate the ample parking around here, making the trip much more pleasant than it could have been. Will definitely come back to try other things!

excerpts: Snowy Plover

any scone
espresso
yum
snowy plover.author: Liz B.
snowy plover.review:
How much do I love Andytown? Let me enumerate the ways. Great great coffee, kind proprietors who are sweet to children and can discuss Irish literature, pastries baked on site delicious enough to rival Tartine. Yes I said it. Tartine. 

Back to coffee, it's always back to coffee. I'm a third wave snob, so I usually only drink coffee roasted by hand in antique Probats which was grown in the shade of an ancient baobab tree with a 100 year old yogi living in it and picked by indigenous people in control of their own destinies and who receive hourly reiki massage from the people who work at yelp. 

And yet, even coffee sourced that carefully doesn't come close to the subtle nuances I detect in that which was roasted with such care and love by Michael McCrory and prepared by the Maestra, Lauren Crabbe. Get yourself some. 

Snowy Plover
any scone
espresso
yum

excerpts: They serve your standard brewed espresso drinks but also an interesting drink called the Snowy Plover - a coffee soda would be the best way to describe it!
snowy plover.author: Tracy Joy K.
snowy plover.review:
I have been to my fair share of independent roasters and Andytown definitely impressed me! Located in the Outer Sunset it brings a hipster style but friendly and welcoming service. There was a bit of a line when we came but since parking was so easy we decided to try it out! The line goes faster than it looks, it is mostly long on account for how tiny the place is. 

They serve your standard brewed espresso drinks but also an interesting drink called the Snowy Plover - a coffee soda would be the best way to describe it! I also was a rebel and tried their hot cocoa. 
You can opt for a fresh whipped cream to go with your drinks :)

I loved that they have a select variety of baked items as well, all huge and yummy. We tried four different baked goods including my favorite the Peach and Goat Cheese corn muffing along with Blueberry corn muffin, chocolate scone and cherry scone. 

I appreciated their friendly service and really great value considering all we ordered! Will definitely be back :)

excerpts: The Snowy Plover ($4), named after a bird, is a specialty coffee of Andytown that I have read about in numerous publications but ran across most recently in a Bold Italic article.
Sparkling water, a little simple syrup, espresso over ice, and topped with a house made whipped cream scoop makes a beverage that looks and tastes as smooth as Guinness.
I wholeheartedly recommend coming by and trying this unique take on an americano.
The soda current scone ($2.75??)
I purchased was outstanding as well.
Although the shop isn't large enough to set up shop for a work or study session, there is some outside seating for you to enjoy until the traffic cops come sweeping through.
Just a reminder, don't park on the street from noon till 2 the 1st and 3rd Friday of the month!
snowy plover.author: Temo B.
snowy plover.review: Is there anything better than a slightly overcast, blustery ocean breeze afternoon in the Outer Sunset District of San Francisco? If it hadn't been so early I probably would have opted for a Guinness at a local pub, but I chose a little pick me up and a scone instead. The Snowy Plover ($4), named after a bird, is a specialty coffee of Andytown that I have read about in numerous publications but ran across most recently in a Bold Italic article. Sparkling water, a little simple syrup, espresso over ice, and topped with a house made whipped cream scoop makes a beverage that looks and tastes as smooth as Guinness. I wholeheartedly recommend coming by and trying this unique take on an americano. The soda current scone ($2.75??) I purchased was outstanding as well. Although the shop isn't large enough to set up shop for a work or study session, there is some outside seating for you to enjoy until the traffic cops come sweeping through. Just a reminder, don't park on the street from noon till 2 the 1st and 3rd Friday of the month!

excerpts: I will have to echo that you MUST try the Snowy Plover.
Perfectly carbonated, caffeinated and sweet.
snowy plover.author: Darline D.
snowy plover.review:
For someone who works at a coffee shop, I have to admit, this has become my favorite coffee shop. I've made it a point to come here almost every weekend, dragging my boyfriend along (he can vouch how much I love this place). 

Environment- So cute and simple. The clean white walls/shelves/counters are nicely accented with fresh flowers and plants sprinkled throughout. There's nice tiny seating both in and out which suits the cafe. I love that they have dog treats in front. 

Food/Drink - I love love LOVE their sausage rolls, if only they made them every day. :( Their fresh fruit muffins are also amazing, the strawberry corn muffin fresh out of the oven is hard to beat. The boyfriend goes with either the cheddar scallion scone or the wheat bread with raw cheddar and bacon. They serve them on little wooden boards if they are "for here" which is wonderful. Their latte's are perfectly foamed and the art is exquisite. You can tell the owners care a lot about their craft. I will have to echo that you MUST try the Snowy Plover. Perfectly carbonated, caffeinated and sweet. Their homemade whipped cream is to die for.

Service - AMAZING. They are all extremely welcoming. 

**I do love that they use Square because I never have cash on me, and I can tip them through my card.

excerpts: 5 stars for fast and friendly service, snowy plover, latte, and goat cheese scones, cleanliness, and close proximity to the beach!
snowy plover.author: Han N.
snowy plover.review:
5 stars for fast and friendly service, snowy plover, latte, and goat cheese scones, cleanliness, and close proximity to the beach! 

First time here, and definitely not my last. I'm bringing all my friends!

excerpts: Snowy plover:)
snowy plover.author: Corrine N.
snowy plover.review: Welcoming, clean and FRIENDLY staff:) Fresh pastries baked in house, roasted coffee in house and topped off with beautifully design flower arrangements.  Highly recommend their signature drink... Snowy plover:)

excerpts: The Snowy Plover is a creation of theirs where they make a version of a Coffee Float using homemade whipped cream.
At the end of the day, this place is the shit, just do it.
(Also everyone who works here is an absolute sweetheart)
snowy plover.author: Noah S.
snowy plover.review: My favorite coffee place in San Francisco. Not only are their Americano's delicious but also properly priced ( I think 2.75). The Snowy Plover is a creation of theirs where they make a version of a Coffee Float using homemade whipped cream. At the end of the day, this place is the shit, just do it. (Also everyone who works here is an absolute sweetheart)

excerpts: The snowy plover was as good as people say.
I am not a surgery coffee drinks fan
but I felt like this specialty coffee drink had just the right amount of sweet mixed with quality coffee.
snowy plover.author: Elizabeth A.
snowy plover.review:
I was visiting my friend who lives in SF and we heard this place was amazing, so we decided to check it out. 

The snowy plover was as good as people say. I am not a surgery coffee drinks fan but I felt like this specialty coffee drink had just the right amount of sweet mixed with quality coffee. Next time I might ask them to put a tad less brown sugar in the drink to make the flavor of coffee override the sweet. 

As for the breakfast sandwiches - better make sure you're there early. We arrived at 10:30 and they were all sold out. :-(

excerpts: I love the espresso here, but I must be the only person who does not like the Snowy Plover.
Ah well.
I tried it on a hot day last month, and I found it to be too cloying.
I'll just be sticking to their reliably excellent cappuccinos and lattes from here on out.
On a gluten-free note, apparently their corn muffins ARE gluten-free, as I learned from my friend with Celiac who runs her own GF bread business.
Woot!
Swing by after the mid-morning rush because long lines are for suckers.

I'll just be sticking to their reliably excellent cappuccinos and lattes from here on out. On a gluten-free note, apparently their corn muffins ARE gluten-free, as I learned from my friend with Celiac who runs her own GF bread business. Woot! Swing by after the mid-morning rush because long lines are for suckers.

Always a good excuse to come out here to pick up some fresh beans and some coffee.
Baked stuff are also tasty and worth the splurge.

snowy plover.author: Josh F.
