snowy plover.review: Excellent! I was introduced to this place by my sister. She told me about the snowy plover and I thought it was a really weird combination. However I couldn't I seem to get the idea outta my mind so I trekked my way here on a Friday afternoon and ordered their infamous drink. Much to my surprise, it was delicious! Tastes better and better with each sip. I've read from the other reviews that their lattes are also really good so I will have to try that next. Definitely recommend if you are in the area!

excerpts: Definitely try the snowy plover (I like it half sweet), and whatever just came out of the oven.
snowy plover.author: mona r.
snowy plover.review: My favorite SF coffee shop, how lucky am I that it's in my neighborhood?! Beans roasted fresh, great drinks (including tea), wonderful baked goods including gluten free corn muffins, friendly staff and sweet owners who know their coffee. Plus locally made goods and coffee accessories. There's outdoor seating too. Definitely try the snowy plover (I like it half sweet), and whatever just came out of the oven.

excerpts: I visited Andytown twice, the first time I got a latte - pretty good but regular latte to me, and the second time I got its famous Snowy Plover.
I love Snowy Plover.
At first I thought it was an odd combo - sparkling water and coffee???!!!
- but I really like iced coffee
so I went ahead and gave it a try.
I love Snowy Plover.
The only complaint I have is, that delicious whip cream takes too much space in the cup so the real liquid with ice I really have is about 1/2 of its 12oz cup.
I have to be really careful and drink super slow for the ice to melt to get more liquid.
What I'm trying to say is, I was not satisfied.
How can they make something so delicious but so small and yet so expensive ($4) that I do not allow myself to buy two cups at a time (no large cup option, I don't think)?
So mean.
I've tried its cookies, and for $1.75 per cookie, they really are just ok.
But I will try its soda bread next time
I'm in town
cuz it seems to be most people's favorites.
Parking sucks (but it does everywhere in Sunset) and the place is small if you want to enjoy your coffee/ pastry there, and
although the line is always out the door, the wait is not so bad.
snowy plover.author: HsuMeow L.
snowy plover.review:
I visited Andytown twice, the first time I got a latte - pretty good but regular latte to me, and the second time I got its famous Snowy Plover. I love Snowy Plover. At first I thought it was an odd combo - sparkling water and coffee???!!! - but I really like iced coffee so I went ahead and gave it a try. I love Snowy Plover. The only complaint I have is, that delicious whip cream takes too much space in the cup so the real liquid with ice I really have is about 1/2 of its 12oz cup. I have to be really careful and drink super slow for the ice to melt to get more liquid. What I'm trying to say is, I was not satisfied. How can they make something so delicious but so small and yet so expensive ($4) that I do not allow myself to buy two cups at a time (no large cup option, I don't think)? So mean.
I've tried its cookies, and for $1.75 per cookie, they really are just ok. But I will try its soda bread next time I'm in town cuz it seems to be most people's favorites.
Parking sucks (but it does everywhere in Sunset) and the place is small if you want to enjoy your coffee/ pastry there, and although the line is always out the door, the wait is not so bad.

excerpts: We decided to try the Snowy Plover since everyone recommended it.
I'm not a huge fan of coffee but this drink was definitely something else.
It's definitely an interesting try.
I recommend this place!
snowy plover.author: Michelle L.
snowy plover.review: My boyfriend is a huge fan of coffee so I decided to go on Yelp. The ambience felt so peaceful and relaxing. Good vibes all around. We decided to try the Snowy Plover since everyone recommended it. I'm not a huge fan of coffee but this drink was definitely something else. It's definitely an interesting try. I recommend this place!

excerpts: The Snowy Plover was more amazing than I had imagined....
I had two!
I paired it with a jalapeño corn scone that was so soft, moist, and savory!
So happy to have found this gem!
Since I came alone I grabbed on of the small bar height tables on the side of the shop.
It was a bit smaller work space than what I was expecting, but once I got cozy
I was able to find focus amidst the buzz of Sunday mid-morning rush.
snowy plover.author: Rebecca M.
snowy plover.review:
I stumbled upon this place this morning for the first time, what a treat! I was searching for a place to grab a bite, a beverage with a kick, and somewhere to get a little work done. I read the other reviews on yelp before heading out of the house.  The Snowy Plover was more amazing than I had imagined.... I had two! I paired it with a jalapeño corn scone that was so soft, moist, and savory! So happy to have found this gem! 
Since I came alone I grabbed on of the small bar height tables on the side of the shop. It was a bit smaller work space than what I was expecting, but once I got cozy I was able to find focus amidst the buzz of Sunday mid-morning rush.

excerpts: The Snowy Plover is totally delicious.
I was a little skeptical about mixing Pelegrino and coffee flavors, but it totally works.
I also tried their Irish soda bread farl (i.e. fourth), which I've never had before, and I really really liked it.
It's served warm and buttered and tastes great on a cold Outer Sunset morning.
snowy plover.author: Jacob R.
snowy plover.review: The Snowy Plover is totally delicious. I was a little skeptical about mixing Pelegrino and coffee flavors, but it totally works. I also tried their Irish soda bread farl (i.e. fourth), which I've never had before, and I really really liked it. It's served warm and buttered and tastes great on a cold Outer Sunset morning.

excerpts: I've had their famous Snowy Plover (try it), Almond milk Lattes (mm so good) and their freshly made scones.
snowy plover.author: 3beeskitchen ..
snowy plover.review:
Yea, it is THAT good. Any establishment with a line out the door is always a good sign. I've had their famous Snowy Plover (try it), Almond milk Lattes (mm so good) and their freshly made scones.

DELICIOUS!

excerpts: I would also highly recommend the snowy plover.
It's like a Italian soda but espresso style.
My only kick back would be that it can be a bit constraining on your wallet.
snowy plover.author: E C.
snowy plover.review: Wow. This place really hits the spot on a June gloom type of day. I had a fresh scallions and cheese scone and just seemed to melt in my mouth. I also tried the strawberry corn muffin, which was moist and delicious. I would also highly recommend the snowy plover. It's like a Italian soda but espresso style. My only kick back would be that it can be a bit constraining on your wallet.

excerpts: The snowy plover is  a must.
Apricot scones, nice breads and very friendly, fun staff.
snowy plover.author: Cliodhna R.
snowy plover.review: YES!!  The snowy plover is  a must. Apricot scones, nice breads and very friendly, fun staff.

excerpts: Got the snowy plover and loved it!
So refreshing.
You can get the regular snowy plover with hand-made whipped cream, or you can opt for almond milk if you like.
I will definitely be coming back again and again.
snowy plover.author: Margaret W.
snowy plover.review: Got the snowy plover and loved it! So refreshing. You can get the regular snowy plover with hand-made whipped cream, or you can opt for almond milk if you like. I will definitely be coming back again and again.

excerpts: Killer apps are the soda bread, any daily pastry specials, aaaand the Snowy Plover.
OMG.
Refreshing and delish, and worth getting even on cold, foggy days (almost everyday).
Get it with the house whipped cream.
Eff your diet.
snowy plover.author: E. W.
snowy plover.review: Quality house roasted coffee and house baked creations. All in the sleepy outer Sunset. Despite it's remote locale, this place is a rightfully sought out destination for the neighborhood locals and visitors alike. Plenty of out door seating alleviates the snug interior. Charming decor, bright, clean, and modern with a touch of rugged outer Sunset beach vibe. Coffee paraphanellia and dish ware on display for sale. Fiercely creative floral arrangements. Srsly. Roasting oven in rear. Roasting days are siren calls for caffeine fix whether you want it or not. Killer apps are the soda bread, any daily pastry specials, aaaand the Snowy Plover. OMG. Refreshing and delish, and worth getting even on cold, foggy days (almost everyday). Get it with the house whipped cream. Eff your diet.

excerpts: Everything about this place is perfect, from the coffee drinks (helllllo, Snowy Plover) to the best pastries (literally the best corn muffins ever) to the super-friendly staff to the background music (Jacques Dutronc?
Oui oui!).
snowy plover.author: Dan S.
snowy plover.review: Yes, yes, yes! Everything about this place is perfect, from the coffee drinks (helllllo, Snowy Plover) to the best pastries (literally the best corn muffins ever) to the super-friendly staff to the background music (Jacques Dutronc? Oui oui!).

excerpts: The Italian style machiatto was wonderfully smooth, my Gibraltar/Cortado was also nice too and my special latte with their sweet syrup they use to make the Snowy Plover drinks was wonderful.
The roast os a perfeft balance of full and rich but not too dark.
Perfect balance.
They also have house made whip which is glorious!
The staff was ao wonderful.
Patient with me and my son and cleaning up the hot chocolate we spilled ALL OVER the inside table.
This place in a true jem
It's my new favorite coffee joint in Califronia!!
snowy plover.author: Elise H.
snowy plover.review:
This is the best coffee shop in San Francisco!  I'm a Ritual fan and always was when I lived in San Francisco, but upon a recent trip back to the bay, I discovered Andytown and fell in love!!  
The staff is warm and friendly, the inside is small and cozy, but well lit and bright. The outside seating is beautiful and the neighborhood feels nice and calm. You're also super close to the beach! 
The Italian style machiatto was wonderfully smooth, my Gibraltar/Cortado was also nice too and my special latte with their sweet syrup they use to make the Snowy Plover drinks was wonderful. The roast os a perfeft balance of full and rich but not too dark. Perfect balance. 
They also have house made whip which is glorious!  The staff was ao wonderful. Patient with me and my son and cleaning up the hot chocolate we spilled ALL OVER the inside table. This place in a true jem It's my new favorite coffee joint in Califronia!!

excerpts: The Snowy Plover seems to be a popular drink but doesn't live up to the hype
but I'd go there again for the coffee.
snowy plover.author: Eric H.
snowy plover.review: Yay! I'm a fan.  Nice location and vibe.  The coffee was great but place was a bit too small.  However, the place really captures the essence of SF and the neighborhood.  The Snowy Plover seems to be a popular drink but doesn't live up to the hype but I'd go there again for the coffee.

excerpts: The first time, I tried their infamous snowy plover, it's essentially a coffee soda but so delish.
I'm don't usually like whipped cream but their homemade whip cream makes the drink!
They offer a variety of muffins, cookies, and scones.
Their service is amazing, they accidently forgot my latte, so the barista kindly made my latte and gave me a free chocolate cookie.
Definitely will go back and try more of their muffins.
snowy plover.author: Jessica Z.
snowy plover.review: I love this place! The first time, I tried their infamous snowy plover, it's essentially a coffee soda but so delish. I'm don't usually like whipped cream but their homemade whip cream makes the drink! They offer a variety of muffins, cookies, and scones. Their service is amazing, they accidently forgot my latte, so the barista kindly made my latte and gave me a free chocolate cookie. Definitely will go back and try more of their muffins.

excerpts: The snowy plover was amazing.
snowy plover.author: Laini H.
snowy plover.review:
Nothing like fresh baked irish soda bread in the ocean breeze. The snowy plover was amazing. Also the bathroom was really nice.

Watched other people enjoy their food and drinks, wanted to try everything.

excerpts: I got the snowy plover and the mocha, both are delicious and are of good quality.
I also got the cheese scallion scone both times and it is incredibly good, especially when you get it fresh out of the oven.
Although there is always a line, the wait for your order is never too long.
I think i've waited about five minutes to get my drink and my scone.
The servers there are also very friendly as well.
I wish I had known about this place sooner as it is only a five minute drive from my home.
Will definitely be coming back to this place!
snowy plover.author: Austin C.
snowy plover.review: This place is amazing. I've been here twice and have had a good experience both times. I got the snowy plover and the mocha, both are delicious and are of good quality. I also got the cheese scallion scone both times and it is incredibly good, especially when you get it fresh out of the oven. Although there is always a line, the wait for your order is never too long. I think i've waited about five minutes to get my drink and my scone. The servers there are also very friendly as well. I wish I had known about this place sooner as it is only a five minute drive from my home. Will definitely be coming back to this place!

excerpts: The snowy plover never disappoints and their home brewed coffee/house-baked scones make the experience unforgettable.
The staff is incredibly friendly providing a homey feel to the already perfect environment!
snowy plover.author: Kim W.
snowy plover.review: Andytown has become one of our family's favorite places to go. The snowy plover never disappoints and their home brewed coffee/house-baked scones make the experience unforgettable. The staff is incredibly friendly providing a homey feel to the already perfect environment!

excerpts: Snowy Plover was unique and delicious.
Baked goodies come right out of their little oven onto their front counter.
On our particular visit they had blackberry corn muffins and cheddar scallion scones.
Incredible!
There is a small communal table inside and several small tables and chairs along the side of the shop.
Can't wait to stop by again.
snowy plover.author: Lisa H.
snowy plover.review: A welcome addition to Outer Sunset! Lovely staff, lovely baked goods and lovely coffee. Snowy Plover was unique and delicious. Baked goodies come right out of their little oven onto their front counter. On our particular visit they had blackberry corn muffins and cheddar scallion scones. Incredible! There is a small communal table inside and several small tables and chairs along the side of the shop. Can't wait to stop by again.

excerpts: I cannot stop thinking about the Snowy Plover!
Why oh why has no one thought of this delightful creation before!
A caffeine fix meets a refreshing beverage.
It is a fabulous creation of bubbly water, espresso, simple syrup topped with homemade whipped cream.
If you are within an hour drive, trust me it is worth your while to make your way to this coffee spot.
And because I cannot make up my mind and have a coffee addiction I also enjoyed a mocha which was divine.
They offer baked goods as well, I tried the two cookies they had to offer.
Trust me when I say this spot us worth the drive to the Sunset!
snowy plover.author: Victoria O.
snowy plover.review: I cannot stop thinking about the Snowy Plover! Why oh why has no one thought of this delightful creation before! A caffeine fix meets a refreshing beverage. It is a fabulous creation of bubbly water, espresso, simple syrup topped with homemade whipped cream. If you are within an hour drive, trust me it is worth your while to make your way to this coffee spot. And because I cannot make up my mind and have a coffee addiction I also enjoyed a mocha which was divine. They offer baked goods as well, I tried the two cookies they had to offer. Trust me when I say this spot us worth the drive to the Sunset!

excerpts: The snowy plover is my new favorite thing in life
and I look forward to it all week, seriously.

I work crazy hours and on my days off I could/should sleep all day but set my alarm so I can get to Andytown before they close at 3pm for my snowy plover and house made bread/cheese/bacon sandwich for breakfast.
I've tried the scones and they are the best I've ever had but that bread with cheese and bacon...ahhhh....
best breakfast and hangover cure.
Yay Andytown.
snowy plover.author: S. C.
snowy plover.review: Update: I had an instant crush on Andytown when I first discovered them and now I'm in LOVE! My husband and I have one day off together and that day is Monday, the only day Andytown is closed :-( I'm seriously thinking of changing my days off so we can make Andytown part of our day off together routine! The snowy plover is my new favorite thing in life and I look forward to it all week, seriously. I work crazy hours and on my days off I could/should sleep all day but set my alarm so I can get to Andytown before they close at 3pm for my snowy plover and house made bread/cheese/bacon sandwich for breakfast. I've tried the scones and they are the best I've ever had but that bread with cheese and bacon...ahhhh.... best breakfast and hangover cure. Yay Andytown.

excerpts: The snowy plover, however, to die for.
snowy plover.author: Crystal F.
snowy plover.review: Cortado, was not so great. Espresso was a little bitter and the foam a bit bubbly. The snowy plover, however, to die for.

excerpts: Inside is light and beachy (perfect for the sunset), the customers were happy and had kids and dogs with them (which I enjoy), the coffee menu was easy to understand, my cappuccino was delicious, my partner's "snowy plover" sparkling iced coffee was a tasty treat, and our chocolate cherry scone was warm and basically perfect.
This place is well worth a trip out, and definitely can't miss it if you're a sunset dweller.
We'll be back soon!
And we are hoping the hours get extended so we can come even more often.
snowy plover.author: Ani H.
snowy plover.review: Seems redundant to post another 5 star review - but oh well, it's fun :)  Dropped in today with middling expectations and walked out totally delighted.  Inside is light and beachy (perfect for the sunset), the customers were happy and had kids and dogs with them (which I enjoy), the coffee menu was easy to understand, my cappuccino was delicious, my partner's "snowy plover" sparkling iced coffee was a tasty treat, and our chocolate cherry scone was warm and basically perfect.  This place is well worth a trip out, and definitely can't miss it if you're a sunset dweller.  We'll be back soon!  And we are hoping the hours get extended so we can come even more often.

excerpts: As if their Sausage Rolls and Regular coffee wasn't enough to earn them 5 stars, the Snowy Plover seals the deal.
My new favorite coffee spot in the Outer Sunset!
snowy plover.author: Eric L.
snowy plover.review: As if their Sausage Rolls and Regular coffee wasn't enough to earn them 5 stars, the Snowy Plover seals the deal. My new favorite coffee spot in the Outer Sunset!

excerpts: I've yet to try the creamy deliciousness that is the well-named snowy plover.
Everyone raves about it though.
I'm strictly a drip coffee or sometimes nonfat Cappucino drinker.
These kind and cheerful folks have those down with fantastic flavored roasted beans.
Their muffins are also worth the drive and run, which is becoming a well worn tradition.
Drive a couple blocks away, park and secure the car, run down to great highway, to sloat blvd, back to Judah or Lincoln, and up to andytown!
It's usually a worthy end to a fun run.
snowy plover.author: Ron W.
snowy plover.review: I've yet to try the creamy deliciousness that is the well-named snowy plover. Everyone raves about it though. I'm strictly a drip coffee or sometimes nonfat Cappucino drinker. These kind and cheerful folks have those down with fantastic flavored roasted beans. Their muffins are also worth the drive and run, which is becoming a well worn tradition. Drive a couple blocks away, park and secure the car, run down to great highway, to sloat blvd, back to Judah or Lincoln, and up to andytown! It's usually a worthy end to a fun run.

excerpts: I've heard about their popular "Snowy Plover" iced coffee drink.
I decided to try it out and was immediately ill.
Severe heartburn, gagging, almost throwing up.
I'm thinking maybe the cream was bad?
Not sure.
If I go back, I'll definitely focus on a latte or other hot coffee drink.
snowy plover.author: Corinne K.
snowy plover.review: Recently visited this coffee shop for the first time. I've heard about their popular "Snowy Plover" iced coffee drink. I decided to try it out and was immediately ill. Severe heartburn, gagging, almost throwing up. I'm thinking maybe the cream was bad? Not sure. If I go back, I'll definitely focus on a latte or other hot coffee drink.

excerpts: I recommend the Snowy Plover drink!
An interesting concoction that is a real surprise.
The Scones and Irish Bread are scrumptious, while traditional they also have a unique twist to them.
I look forward to visiting frequently and getting to know more of my neighbors.
snowy plover.author: Margot M.
snowy plover.review: I am a fan. This neighborhood is in desperate need for quality businesses. Andytown fits the bill. A bright clean sleek interior that is inviting. The Staff is friendly and welcoming. Coffee and Irish treats are delicious. I recommend the Snowy Plover drink! An interesting concoction that is a real surprise. The Scones and Irish Bread are scrumptious, while traditional they also have a unique twist to them. I look forward to visiting frequently and getting to know more of my neighbors.

excerpts: I came here to get the Snowy Plover.
When friends describe this drink they say "It's interesting.
I don't hate it, but I don't love it either.
I tried it and I hated it.
It's essentially an americano with sparking water.
I don't even like normal americanos
so why did I think I would like this one?
I didn't, it's weird and not a good taste.
I did really love the whipped cream they make in house that they put on top
, that was probably the only tasty part of the drink.
I also got to share the iced mocha my girlfriend ordered which I did enjoy.
Next time I come
I will just get a latte and a pastry
but as for the Snowy Plover, it gets two thumbs down.
I will update review after my next visit where I try something else.
snowy plover.author: Jeromy G.
snowy plover.review: I came here to get the Snowy Plover. When friends describe this drink they say "It's interesting. I don't hate it, but I don't love it either." I tried it and I hated it. It's essentially an americano with sparking water. I don't even like normal americanos so why did I think I would like this one? I didn't, it's weird and not a good taste. I did really love the whipped cream they make in house that they put on top, that was probably the only tasty part of the drink. I also got to share the iced mocha my girlfriend ordered which I did enjoy. Next time I come I will just get a latte and a pastry but as for the Snowy Plover, it gets two thumbs down. I will update review after my next visit where I try something else.

excerpts: The drinks are fantastic, especially the latte and snowy plover.
Highly recommended!
snowy plover.author: Connie T.
snowy plover.review: There's always a long line, but it's worth the wait. All the muffins and bake goods are freshly made. The drinks are fantastic, especially the latte and snowy plover. Highly recommended!

excerpts: Fantastic Latte and the Snowy Plover while not something I would get everyday is a real treat and should be tried.
The food here is as good as the coffee.
The staff is top notch and super friendly but without trying to be your friend or obtrusive.
This may be my favorite coffee stop in the Bay Area and that is saying a lot.
snowy plover.author: John P.
snowy plover.review: Wow, what an awesome experience! Fantastic Latte and the Snowy Plover while not something I would get everyday is a real treat and should be tried. The food here is as good as the coffee. The staff is top notch and super friendly but without trying to be your friend or obtrusive. This may be my favorite coffee stop in the Bay Area and that is saying a lot.

excerpts: Snowy plover (pellegrino, espresso, topped with homemade whipped cream) was unusual, delicious, and refreshing.
snowy plover.author: Ben S.
snowy plover.review:
Snowy plover (pellegrino, espresso, topped with homemade whipped cream) was unusual, delicious, and refreshing.

I'm a coffee geek and was disappointed by their drip coffee

excerpts: I'm afraid I didn't like the Snowy Plover, though
-- I had to try it because it's so different, but it didn't really work for me.
Certainly unique!
snowy plover.author: Michael C.
snowy plover.review:
I'm a hard-to-please coffee snob, but this place earned its 5 stars.

One of the best cappuccinos I've ever had, and the bacon and cheddar sandwich was excellent. 

Long line, but worth the wait! I'm afraid I didn't like the Snowy Plover, though -- I had to try it because it's so different, but it didn't really work for me. Certainly unique!

excerpts: I got the Snowy Plover and loved it!
Tip: Mix the whipping cream in with the coffee.
It tasted great, the service was amazing as frazzled as I was, and it was quick as could be!
Everything at Andytown, the decor, the food, the staff was amazing and I can't recommend this place more!
snowy plover.author: Carina M.
snowy plover.review: I went for my first time today and Andytown is amazing! I got the Snowy Plover and loved it! Tip: Mix the whipping cream in with the coffee. It tasted great, the service was amazing as frazzled as I was, and it was quick as could be! Everything at Andytown, the decor, the food, the staff was amazing and I can't recommend this place more!

excerpts: I'm a HUGE fan of the snowy plover.
I also really enjoy their scrumptious scones.
Not only do they do coffee really well, but the owners are ridiculously nice
I live in the Outer Sunset and I am so happy that we now get to enjoy a place like Andytown.
Contrary to some of these other yelp reviews, the sunset really isn't in the middle of nowhere.
San Francisco is a small city folks.
But, I will continue to let others makes their assumptions about this gem of a neighborhood.
It's pretty special and I love it here
snowy plover.author: Abby G.
snowy plover.review: Delicious coffee! I'm a HUGE fan of the snowy plover. I also really enjoy their scrumptious scones. Not only do they do coffee really well, but the owners are ridiculously nice :) I live in the Outer Sunset and I am so happy that we now get to enjoy a place like Andytown. Contrary to some of these other yelp reviews, the sunset really isn't in the middle of nowhere. San Francisco is a small city folks. But, I will continue to let others makes their assumptions about this gem of a neighborhood. It's pretty special and I love it here :)

excerpts: Had the Snowy Plover, and it met my expectations based on other reviews.
Fizzy, creamy coffee--a really interesting experience.
I also got a piece of the soda bread with butter and cheese, a cocoa nib and salt cookie, and a strawberry corn muffin.
All items were delicious.
Ambiance was modern yet inviting.
Staff was super pleasant.
Definitely a new favorite spot, and it doesn't hurt that it's close to home!
snowy plover.author: Kandi K.
snowy plover.review: Had the Snowy Plover, and it met my expectations based on other reviews.  Fizzy, creamy coffee--a really interesting experience.  I also got a piece of the soda bread with butter and cheese, a cocoa nib and salt cookie, and a strawberry corn muffin.  All items were delicious.  Ambiance was modern yet inviting.  Staff was super pleasant.  Definitely a new favorite spot, and it doesn't hurt that it's close to home!

excerpts: Now I'm addicted to the snowy plover.
I'm not a big coffee drinker, but that was is really good.
It did get some used to after a few sips cause of the bubbles, but having it sweetened with their whip cream was very good.
Also I got the raspberry corn bread with an apricot fill.
It was yummy.
I think this is my new place to go to.
snowy plover.author: Melanie T.
snowy plover.review: My friend got me to try their strawberry corn muffin. It was really good. Now I'm addicted to the snowy plover. I'm not a big coffee drinker, but that was is really good. It did get some used to after a few sips cause of the bubbles, but having it sweetened with their whip cream was very good. Also I got the raspberry corn bread with an apricot fill. It was yummy. I think this is my new place to go to.

excerpts: Snowy Plover is really good, never think espresso with sparkling soda and whipped cream can mixed!!!
They also have good pastries... and yummy Italian soda.
I'd recommend the chocolate eclairs.. love this place!
snowy plover.author: Lan P.
snowy plover.review: Snowy Plover is really good, never think espresso with sparkling soda and whipped cream can mixed!!!  They also have good pastries... and yummy Italian soda.  I'd recommend the chocolate eclairs.. love this place!

excerpts: Great staff, parking, and snowy plover.
5 stars.
snowy plover.author: Connie C.
snowy plover.review: Great staff, parking, and snowy plover. 5 stars.

excerpts: Michael and Lauren made me three amazing drinks, a house espresso, a two-bean blend drip coffee & their original snowy plover iced beverage.
snowy plover.author: Kelly S.
snowy plover.review:
I visited Andytown for the first time today. Michael and Lauren made me three amazing drinks, a house espresso, a two-bean blend drip coffee & their original snowy plover iced beverage. They also helped me choose which beans I wanted to buy with helpful descriptions and recommendations of their single-origin coffees.

Thank you Andytown! I will be back soon!

excerpts: i loved the snowy plover.
i wish they offered a bigger size of it.
i drink way too much coffee
and i can't stop,
so, like, a 32oz would be nice : )
snowy plover.author: Mae I.
snowy plover.review: i loved the snowy plover. i wish they offered a bigger size of it. i drink way too much coffee and i can't stop, so, like, a 32oz would be nice : )

excerpts: For a novel treat, try the Snowy Plover (fizzy H2O, espresso and house-made whipped cream).
This place has caught on, so your wait may include some sidewalk time, but the crew are fast, clever and friendly, so squeeze in and hold on.
You're in for a bonafide and luxurious cuppa joe.
Dig it!
Indoor seating is limited, but don't be afraid to squeeze in at the gorgeous community table in the front.
Most often a seat is open outside.
snowy plover.author: Holly D.
snowy plover.review: Now we're talking! The Outer Sunset's swank, clean-lines, caffeinated pride and glory has arrived!! As a self-proclaimed (and popularly acknowledged) coffee snob, I say --without trepidation-- that Andytown Coffee Roasters is, hands-down, the finest damn cuppa in the over-coffeed city of Sam Framcisco.  Michael, Lauren and the team understand crema, and pay homage to ristretto. They roast their own, on-site, and pull masterful shots (on a Kees van der Westen, Idrocompresso, nonetheless) so you are guaranteed the freshest, purest and smoothest pour in town.  Their traditional and Irish-inspired handmade pastries are delicious, and include a daily selection of gluten-free corn (+fresh, local fruit) muffins, savory sausage rolls, soda bread and a mascarpone/berry "Patriot" scone, which will knock your red-white-and-blues to the moon.  Note the modern, yet organic appointments, like bamboo serving trays and hand-thrown mugs. For a novel treat, try the Snowy Plover (fizzy H2O, espresso and house-made whipped cream).  This place has caught on, so your wait may include some sidewalk time, but the crew are fast, clever and friendly, so squeeze in and hold on. You're in for a bonafide and luxurious cuppa joe. Dig it! Indoor seating is limited, but don't be afraid to squeeze in at the gorgeous community table in the front.  Most often a seat is open outside.

excerpts: I don't even drink coffee, but after I saw a friend's Snowy Plover on Facebook, biking to Andytown became my new weekend ritual.
Wonderful drinks and pastries, and the friendliest staff.
Definitely worth the trek.

excerpts: Great coffee, awesome gluten-free strawberry cornmeal muffins ...and the SNOWY PLOVER.
So, so good.
snowy plover.author: Susan C.
snowy plover.review: Andytown is fantastic.  Great coffee, awesome gluten-free strawberry cornmeal muffins ...and the SNOWY PLOVER.  So, so good.

excerpts: We also ordered the Snowy Plover and an Almond Milk Mocha - both of which we weren't too thrilled about.
I really think the Snowy Plover is an acquired taste - a lot of folks rave about it (here in the reviews and in the shop as well)
but, I unfortunately, could only get half of it down.
Just not a fan of sparkling water and espresso.
The almond milk and mocha had a slightly off after taste - but I really think that maybe mochas can't be done well with almond milk...
we've tried that combo at a few great coffee shops and it just didn't work out.
I'll have to go back and just try their coffee with milk - and I would def come back!
snowy plover.author: Janelle H.
snowy plover.review: Cute, cozy oceanside coffee house in the Outer Sunset. Came by on a Sunday late morning to a long line (there's a church across the street so they get lots of consistent customers after their service), but it moves.  Favorite part about the experience was the shop's interior - feels really cozy, warm, open, airy, cheerful (great use of white and reclaimed wood) even on foggy mornings.  If eating/drinking in, they serve your order on these cute wooden platters.  We had the cheddar/corn/jalapeno muffin and the strawberry scone - both came out of the oven fresh and they were lovely - definitely recommend.  I hear all their baked goods are excellent so I'm pretty sure you can't go wrong.  We also ordered the Snowy Plover and an Almond Milk Mocha - both of which we weren't too thrilled about.  I really think the Snowy Plover is an acquired taste - a lot of folks rave about it (here in the reviews and in the shop as well) but, I unfortunately, could only get half of it down.  Just not a fan of sparkling water and espresso.  The almond milk and mocha had a slightly off after taste - but I really think that maybe mochas can't be done well with almond milk...we've tried that combo at a few great coffee shops and it just didn't work out.  I'll have to go back and just try their coffee with milk - and I would def come back!

excerpts: The snowy plover, the sausage roll, currant scones...yummmm.
I seriously can't stop craving the snowy plover, which reminds me of Bibi Caffes they used to import to the US.
However, this is so much better and delicious with the Pellegrino and fresh whipped cream.

I hope that make sense, but I enjoyed it
black tea.author: Anh T.
black tea.review:
*Supposedly the snowy plover drink ($4) is one of their best seller, however I didn't know what it was until I got home and read Yelp reviews :( so I regret for not getting it.... The snowy plover is an espresso drink mixed with Italian soda and topped with homemade whipped cream, sounds very intriguing!

*The lineup can be a pain but it moves very quickly, also if you are in SF and there is no line up at a shop, you know that place ain't popular by locals ;).

-Lyons Tea Au Lait - $3.25: 
Essentially a tea latte, and if I remember correctly it was black tea! The tea wasn't too strong and there was some smoothness to it? I hope that make sense, but I enjoyed it and I appreciate how the barista held back on the syrup too.

-Soda Black Currant Scone - $4.00: 
Initially I was afraid that the soda scone would be dry, however it was still warm and moist inside. The blackcurrant tasted like concentrated blackberry and it wasn't too overpowering either.

excerpts: I loved the hot chocolate for its presentation and for its adult taste... more like dark chocolate, thick, creamy, not too sweet- unlike traditional hot cocoa which is more sugar than chocolate.
hot cocoa.author: RACHELLE T.
hot cocoa.review:
Such nice people there! Tried both the matcha latte and matcha plover. Loved the latte! The plover was nothing like I've ever tasted before! Not bad at all but not yet sure if I love it. I think I'll try a regular snowy plover next time. 

The soda bread with butter tasted so good. It's literally flat white bread toasted with melted butter but even though it was so simple it was so comforting. And surprisingly filling for me.

I loved the hot chocolate for its presentation and for its adult taste... more like dark chocolate, thick, creamy, not too sweet- unlike traditional hot cocoa which is more sugar than chocolate. 

The three drinks, scone, and soda bread came out to just under $20. A little much for pastries I think, but a little indulgence for a chance to sit outside on a beautiful gray Fall morning is well worth it.

excerpts: Hot cocoa was my selection, and it was made how it should be - with actual cocoa
/warm milk and not some mix like chain coffee shops might give you.
Rich, flavorful, and delicious.
hot cocoa.author: Kailyn T.
hot cocoa.review:
An (almost) perfect coffee shop! Tucked away near the Sunset, a well-lit corner shop that proves both classy and inviting. They clearly know (and love) their coffee. They clearly love their space. Certain coffee shops I've been to with this sort of style - the oh so perfect, artsy, creative spots - seem to make me feel uncomfortable, like I don't fit into the image. Andytown, however, was extremely welcoming. All of the employees I interacted with seemed very genuine, passionate, and super chill. The pricing is reasonable. Along the walls there are really neat artwork pieces, like the mugs. 

Hot cocoa was my selection, and it was made how it should be - with actual cocoa /warm milk and not some mix like chain coffee shops might give you. Rich, flavorful, and delicious. So perfect for the chill breeze of a San Francisco Autumn evening. 

The one thing that makes this place not perfect is that there is very little seating inside, one corner table and a few small stool type seats against the wall. It's such a nice place I really wish I had more space to sit and stay while I enjoy my drink. 

Overall, such a great spot - I'll visit again! 

(TOP 100 PLACES TO EAT IN 2015, #23)

excerpts: We also tried the mocha, and while we liked the chocolate-y-ness of it, it lacked any coffee flavor, so just resembled more of a hot cocoa.
hot cocoa.author: Mel T.
hot cocoa.review:
Let me preface this to say I am by no means a coffee aficionado, but I do enjoy a sweet cup every now and then. 

I'd heard about Andytown and its infamous Snowy Plover and decided to give it a whirl.  As others have described, it's Pellegrino and espresso topped with a dollop of whipped cream.  I was very skeptical of the drink; I'm already not a fan of sparkling water, so I'm not sure what I expected.  I think it's basically a drink that you either love or hate, and unfortunately I fell into the latter camp.

We also tried the mocha, and while we liked the chocolate-y-ness of it, it lacked any coffee flavor, so just resembled more of a hot cocoa.

I really really wanted to like this place with its friendly workers and super cute space, but perhaps I'll just have to settle for their pastries.

excerpts: There's also non-coffee choices, such as hot cocoa and tea.
hot cocoa.author: Sarah M.
hot cocoa.review:
Great atmosphere, delicious food, and, most importantly, fantastic coffee. The shop is bright, clean, and simple, which makes it feel airy, even though it's a long and narrow space. There's a communal table in the front, small wall tables along the side (each with a plug below it), and outdoor seating in front of the shop.

The coffee menu has the usual lattes and drip coffee, and unique options, like the Snowy Plover (espresso cream soda). There's also non-coffee choices, such as hot cocoa and tea.

The food menu includes soda bread, scones, sausage rolls (highly recommended) and cookies.

The Sunset is lucky to have a coffee roaster, and a cafe that doesn't have the pretension of other coffee places in SF.

excerpts: I also was a rebel and tried their hot cocoa.
You can opt for a fresh whipped cream to go with your drinks
hot cocoa.author: Tracy Joy K.
hot cocoa.review:
I have been to my fair share of independent roasters and Andytown definitely impressed me! Located in the Outer Sunset it brings a hipster style but friendly and welcoming service. There was a bit of a line when we came but since parking was so easy we decided to try it out! The line goes faster than it looks, it is mostly long on account for how tiny the place is. 

They serve your standard brewed espresso drinks but also an interesting drink called the Snowy Plover - a coffee soda would be the best way to describe it! I also was a rebel and tried their hot cocoa. 
You can opt for a fresh whipped cream to go with your drinks :)

I loved that they have a select variety of baked items as well, all huge and yummy. We tried four different baked goods including my favorite the Peach and Goat Cheese corn muffing along with Blueberry corn muffin, chocolate scone and cherry scone. 

I appreciated their friendly service and really great value considering all we ordered! Will definitely be back :)
